8 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 avril 2021
Maquette is a beautiful game with a few really good (and hard) puzzles, but it's little more than that. Only rarely does it flesh out its core mechanics to the max, allowing/requiring you to travel across more than one level of its fractal, recursive world. Most of the time you're dealing with only two levels, making items smaller or bigger to suit your needs (like in Superluminal).

Maquette does shine, though, on a handful of puzzles which require a lot of spatial awareness and lateral thinking. It has charming visuals and an amazing soundtrack. Really, the songs are the best feature of this game. The length is also good, and the game doesn't overstay its welcome.

The story is a bit lackluster, and doesn't add a lot to the enjoyment of the game. But what really tips the scale towards not recommending it is the glitches and bugs. This game could really use a few months of play-testing before being released. As of April/2021, and after some patches, it's still easy to get stuck clipping through objects. It does not encourage exploration also: I found a way to go one level higher, without exploiting any glitches, by using a staircase in Wedge. I thought there would be something there, or at least an achievement, but instead you're awarded with falling through the map forever. :(

All in all, Maquette is still a decent game, and I had fun playing it. At a 40% or higher discount, I'd recommend going for it. But at full price, there are many better options out there.
 
GoldSkulltulaHunter

4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2021
Neat idea, pretty visuals, but the actual puzzles are lacking in creativity. The recursive mechanic was rarely ever an integral part of the solution. There are so many cool ideas to be had here, but so few was used. Take for instance in one of the last levels you are able to pick up the recursive maquette, and when tilting it will tilt the gravity outside. However that mechanic was never actually used for anything, which is a real shame. When the game finally introduces some worthwhile mechanics, the game is already over.

Watch this go on for years, and see them refuse to grow as a person, while everyone they ever date eventually gets sick of their ♥♥♥♥ and leaves?

I hope you enjoy listening to them blame other people for their relationship problems, because that's the cringefest that Maquette is in a nutshell.

Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
Interesting mechanic that they seemed to struggle to find a good plot to go with it so they chose some sappy love story that you follow along as you play the game but in the 4 hours I've played seem to have nothing to do with the "magic" of the game world, past they change some of the visuals to match the story, maybe in the end the extremely grounded love story comes together with the magical size shifting world, but so far the love story is just a nauseating slow down in the gameplay I wish I could just skip. None of the dialog seems to have anything to do with what's going on with the puzzles so you could just turn off the sound and ignore the text and do fine.

The puzzles themselves are pretty decent though some are pretty out there, the few times I got stuck and had to get help online, most of the time I wound up thinking "yeah I should have seen that/thought outside the box, it's a new way of thinking" but a few of them are "ugg, really, how contrived and unintuitive from what we've seen in the rest of the game and can see in the puzzle itself."

From a puzzle standpoint it still gets a slight yes, but the sappy love story is just ruining the experience. It might be cliche but I'd be a lot less turned off if it had something to do with "a wizard did it".

Évaluation publiée le 26 juillet 2023
Puzzles designed not like:
here is ALL data about puzzle, figure out how to SOLVE (like Portal or Talos Principle)
but
here is the level, GUESS about mechanics (except perspective, this moment devs deigned to explain) and data about puzzle, then solve.
I dont like guessing in logic games. It is unfair - I can't know which level elements are pieces of puzzle, which not. I CANT GUESS THAT HERO THAT BARELY JUMPS CAN JUMP OVER ONE SINGLE PLACE IN LEVEL THAT VISUALLY DONT LOOK CROSSABLE AT ALL! Well, I can actually, but it boring and lazy design. I'm sure there are time limited and pixel hunting puzzles further in the game, don't want to check.
 
al123od
665 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 aout 2022
不推荐游玩，但也不想给差评。

不少人会把这款游戏和Superliminal一起提及，诚然，二者在核心机制的表现上十分相似：通过拿起、放置来改变物品大小。但二者的差距不是一般的大，主要体现在二者在想法实现上的巨大鸿沟。不说谜题设计，这个可能和工作室的风格有关，也很难找到一个客观标准，但Maquette在世界架构上就已经远远不如Superliminal。Maquette的世界架构给人的感觉是“不自信”：触发式的进度判定（而非通过一般的游戏机制）、一大堆空气墙限制着玩家的移动（且并不是哪里都有，时有时无，给人的感觉是发现了一处漏洞就补一下）等等。总的来说，Maquette作为一款空间解谜并没有给玩家搭建一个完全放开（或者说自洽）的舞台，经常会让玩家感到束手束脚。在这方面传送门和Superliminal是优秀的代表。一个高下立判的例子：Superliminal中也存在递归空间（而这还不是它的核心玩法），而流程到中后期一个非常重要的流程就是打破这个递归，出现悖论，进入最后更为梦幻的流程；而在Maquette这样一个以递归为核心玩法的游戏中，猜猜当你想要打破递归时会发生什么？没错，游戏会直接闪退。当然，可以理解这种脑洞极大的想法实现起来非常不易，那就只能为这部游戏在玩法上的欠缺感到遗憾了。
再从谜题设计上提一嘴，这部作品的很多机制根本就没有任何提示，比如用水晶相碰开门，或者楼梯有双层，这些机制甚至很难靠观察来学习，更有可能的是碰运气，再不济只能查攻略了。

另外，这个游戏的感情故事还挺细腻的，有人说是扣分点，但个人感觉和谜题部分比起来也就没那么平庸了。
 
Neanderthal
79 produits enregistrés
0

⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿
 
Livin
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
13.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 octobre 2021
按电影的说法，这个游戏属于高概念机制游戏了，光是看一下预告就能感到游戏带来的那种奇妙时刻，这个玩法非常依赖视觉设计，而Maquette在这方面也做得非常棒。

但是，玩起来有点奇怪，解密类型如果和沙盒做了结合，那么解法也最好多元一点，比如荒野之息这种，在Maquette里因为玩家在大部分关卡里可以改变自己的尺寸，所以偶尔会出现玩家能做的事“太多”的情况，比如早期的某一关卡中玩家可以缩小自己的的体型进入到一个房子里，这个过程因为玩家速度随着尺寸变小而变慢变得异常艰辛和无趣，但和正确解法没有关系，可能是为了安慰玩家，游戏在这里也放了一些小玩意，但是这种体验在解密游戏中还是略糟糕。

最近玩的很多这种创新型的解密游戏都有这类问题，不过度限制玩家行为很多时候是好的，但是对于只有唯一解的解谜游戏，这种做法难道不是让玩家绕远路而完全不做提醒吗？

游戏后期关卡直接改成了线性解密，体验上流畅了许多，甚至感觉深度也上来不少，不过感觉和前半部分有点脱节，那种灵气也有点消失了，这大概就是鱼与熊掌不可兼得吧。
 
星轮
1,421 produits enregistrés

Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2021
I very much enjoy puzzle games in this style, and Maquette seemed to have some potential. The early puzzles are kind of simplistic, but that's to be expected. However, the vocal interludes and other aspects of heavy stylization that will probably make this an indie darling turned me off hard and made me put it down before I got very far.

Roughly - people who enjoy love stories but are only somewhat interested in puzzle games will probably be engrossed, people who like puzzle games but give romance a skip are going to find that the romance is way too front and center of what the game wants to be.

Non recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 mars 2021
Игра очень красивая, это ее главный, очень большой, но, к сожалению, единственный плюс.

Сюжет.. Мы находимся в паззле, на стенах которого периодически зачем-то возникают части рассказа о чьей-то истории любви. История эта неинтересная, не захватывающая, но самое главное - не имеющая никакого отношения к игровому процессу. Представьте, что вам, например, в Doom на стенах бы время от времени рассказывали о том, как познакомилась пара молодых людей. Здесь это столь же уместно. Но сюжет можно было бы простить, не обращать внимания, если бы сама игра была хороша, но...

Создается ощущение, что в команде разработчиков был классный и увлеченный художник, а остальные работали на от***сь. Игра выглядит сделанной совсем неаккуратно: я играл около часа но успел столкнуться с кучей мелких, но многочисленных раздражающих багов.

Объекты, которые вы держите в руках (а эта игра про подбирание предметов в одном месте и размещение их в другом), мешают вам ходить и поворачивать камеру. Если, держа перед собой вещь вы будете поворачиваться в сторону, и эта вещь упрется в стену, то вы не сможете туда повернуться. Таким образом игрок постоянно "залипает" в геометрии уровня.

Положил предмет на пол лифта, поехал на лифте вверх, лифт уехал, предмет прошел сквозь пол и остался на месте. И это не случайный баг физики, оно всегда так работает.

Единственный способ выйти из титров - закрыть игру. И так далее...

Если бы, оставив игру включенной, я не накрутил счетчик игровых часов до двух с лишним, я бы запросил возврат. Аннапурна отличный издатель, но с этим проектом они явно поторопились.

 
Elegar
254 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2023
It's okay. A game to appreciate for an evening.

The good:
  • Looks good
  • Recursive 3d puzzles and other variations of this idea
    (getting a little more crazy closer to the end of the game)
Subjective:
  • A story of love and relationship!
    A somewhat uncommon setting for a puzzle game, but hey.
    Also a little cliche, but has some good moments.
    If it's not your cup of tea, you can straight up not read anything (and skip cutscenes) and this won't affect puzzles.
The less good:
  • Player physics in this game are kind of horrendous, really - movement speed is inconsistent (I think the game re-adjusts level and player sizes at some points), jumping is weird, and sometimes (when you are small and terrain is big, or if when standing on some slope), you can't jump at all!
    And when you are trying to place an object, camera sensitivity lowers and the game won't let you rotate the camera if this means hitting the object against something. Kind of dreadful, really
  • Although the game tries to offer some guidance on what to do next by softly walling off other areas, a lot of puzzle-solving comes down to finding the movable objects (which have a little shine animation), placing them at in the smaller version of the level, and trying to climb them in the current version of the level while wondering whether you are solving the puzzle or simply breaking it.
 
YellowAfterlife

Non recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
It's... okay?
Very similar to Superliminal, but the puzzles are not as good. Handling objects is often frustrating, and the story is very typical people in love oh no they broke up the end.
Accurately predicted the game was written and designed by the same person because it feels it.

Game length is probably more like 2-3 hours if you don't get stuck, but there's very few puzzles you go "AHA" and feel like you achieved something. Quite a few of them are "oh I was supposed to touch [insert object that's just out in the open and not a puzzle here]".
Would recommend on discount, but don't recommend otherwise.
Soundtrack is pretty nice tho.

5,864 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2022
A work of art in every sense of the word! And it's much more than that! I expected just an experimental game built on the idea of the "fractal space" mechanics. And that is very cool and mind bending in itself, but this game delivers MUCH MORE. Before and after the levels centered around "the dome", there are other levels based on fantastic ideas and with incredible visuals. They could've got away with much less, just building levels and puzzles on the main idea, but they did more, and I'm extremely grateful for that.
It's not a perfect game. Above all, I'm sorry they didn't get 5x the budget to make it look even more beautiful. It's gorgeous anyway but has a "low poly" feel to it, which I personally don't like, it feels cheap. I also felt zero connection to the story - it was cheesy and not very deeply written. And it had a few bugs too (frankly I'm surprised it has only that few, given the fractal mechanics - I'm sure it was not easy to program this environment). But all these can be ignored and one can just jump in and enjoy the ride in this unique and exciting world!
I will definitely play it again!
 
Baszahatizsak
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 septembre 2022
Haven't finished the game yet, but I made sure I read a lot of reviews before buying this, since it's very mixed.
Deciding whether or not you want this game depends on what you're down with.
If you enjoy lovely art direction/atmosphere, decent writing with great voice acting, and okay use of recursion, then this will be a very pleasant experience for you, as it is for me.
If you want something that provides comfortable controls, complex/clever puzzles, and an unpredictable story, that's not really what you'll get.

This game has puzzles. But like many said, they're mostly simple with usually obvious solutions.
But many people also said the world doesn't match the story, and I STRONGLY disagree.
The use of colors, lighting, music, and locations match the feelings that this story goes through very well. Memories represented in an imaginary world we escape to, while reflecting on how we saw everything. Several visual metaphors are even used for puzzles.
As for the story itself, it's fairly simple and predictable (so far. I haven't finished it yet, but reviews said the rest is simple), but executed very well by the solid writing of the dialogue, fantastic voice acting, and incredible cutscenes of animated drawings. I feel the puzzles are there for the sake of some gameplay, but mainly focuses on telling a story, kinda like What Remains of Edith Finch, which I personally dig.

Now for the more objective issues.
Controls for moving objects can be a chore. It's easy to forget what button is for dropping, holding out, and putting back. And when holding out an object, you move slow, and can't move your camera if you get too close to a surface.
It can also be easy to miss clear solutions if you don't look closely enough, like gem-shaped holes that you need to make objects small enough for, or platforming over some rocks to get outside of your zone. Puzzles like these aren't good as much as they are confusing.

Overall, if the lack of much real puzzle gameplay, and stiff controls won't get in your way of enjoying this pretty game and its decently told story, then it's a solid recommend on sale. I got it for 10 bucks.
 
hawkhill

빅비
1,432 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2021
一个步行模拟解谜游戏，看到发行商是Annapurna就大概能知道是个什么风格的游戏了吧——短小，精致，文艺，唯美，创意十足。

游戏的创意体现在其关卡设计上，其采用了分形的思路，大箱庭套小箱庭，无限套下去（至于商店界面所说的埃舍尔的风格我觉得游戏没有体现出来，虽然埃舍尔的确会在作品中采用分形的图像，但是其标志性的透视错觉却没有在本游戏中体现）。解谜的主要手段是改变物品的尺寸或者改变玩家的尺寸，解谜思路有点像SUPERLIMINAL，只不过不是通过透视来改变尺寸而是通过大小箱庭来改变。谜题难度中上，部分谜题不是那么容易想出来，思维需要跳跃一点才行。

游戏的剧情讲了两个人相恋，交往，同居，分手，最后走出的过程，参考下Florence那种感觉。

游戏的音乐非常棒，且进入得恰到好处，但是游戏大部分时候其实是没有BGM的。

游戏虽然有汉化但是不是每个句子都会蹦字幕，最好能看懂一些简单的英语。

总而言之，是个适合在星期天的下午一口气通关的游戏。
 
kanae
1,013 produits enregistrés

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
先上评价
个人评分8/10
优点：
+故事动人
+美术风格
+画面优良
+配乐好听
+++演出效果炒鸡好
缺点：
-转动视角不流畅，有类似掉帧的卡顿感但是帧数指示器没有显示帧率下降
-拾取和放置物品操作有时候会卡住，操作没有极度舒适
-配乐有时候消失的比较突然
-如果你想用中文玩，由于字体大小和字幕背景颜色的关系可能会比较破坏沉浸感，而且偶尔字幕会消失（为什么要用字幕的形式做本地化呢？）
--解密引导不太好，偶尔会小卡关，其实难度不高，但是试错后要来回多跑一趟导致本来流畅的游戏体验因为跑路中断，一顿操作甚至有小概率死档要重读关卡

总的来说，我认为值回票价，流程不长，一口气玩的话全程2.5小时上下，故事有糖有刀，虽然总体走向不出人意料但是讲得不错。场景制作和演出效果都让我觉得这个钱交的不亏，十足的佳作，在谜题设计和各种流程引导上可以做的更好，不知道后续更新是否会打磨，如果你是步行模拟器爱好者，或者曾被伊迪芬奇惊艳过，请立刻购买，如果你是一般通过，可以考虑下，当前价格(63元）对于本作可能稍高了一些。

10/10 for sure

This Is my first review of any game I have played ever. I have to write this review because I have never been wowed by a game like this. Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2021
Идея составить свои «500 дней лета» из рекурсивных головоломок поначалу кажется очень вдохновляющей — и это чувство то и дело возвращается в процессе игры, способной и подкинуть неплохую пищу для ума, и растрогать. Но стать чем-то большим, нежели изящно исполненная безделушка, у Maquette не получается — мешает разрыв между формой и содержанием. Однако эта безделушка всё же способна занять место на вашей полке для тёплых воспоминаний — особенно если история, рассказанная её авторами, затронет струны вашей души и, возможно, поможет смириться с чем-то несбывшимся.

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 avril 2021
I would cautiously recommend this game to lovers of puzzles out of interest if nothing else. The central mechanic is genuinely clever and the best of the puzzles are satisfying and fun, unfortunately others... could have stood a little more play-testing. Also certain puzzle ideas could have been expanded on to make the game both longer and better.

On the negative side the controls are janktastic, not so much an issue with the majority of puzzles because they mostly rely on figuring out the trick and are then pretty generous with how accurate your actions have to be but definitely a problem when the solution is suddenly platforming or that one time there's a time limit.

And finally there's the story, it's well told and well voice acted and basically the most polished part of the game, but.... it's the wrong story for this game, or perhaps this is the wrong game for that story or both. This game needed a story about worlds within worlds or repeating patterns or scale or something, that story needed game-play that tied into the repeating motif of a shared sketchbook.

In conclusion, interesting game, but far from perfect.
 
Velvet_Violetta
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2021
The most puzzling experience that Maquette offers is the sight of its credits – to be exact, their length. It's surprising how many people worked on this game and it still got published as is.

I have several issues with this product, the worst of which is the control scheme. However, even if technical issues were fixed in the future, the game is just not interesting as a puzzler nor as some plot delivery device.


Controls

To pick up an item, you have to right-click it. This makes you carry it in front of your character, locking your camera straight onto it, and slowing you to a crawl. To unlock the camera and walk at normal speed, you have to left-click after picking up the item. To drop it, you have to right-click to carry it in front of you again, then right-click again to finally let go.

I don't understand why these actions are bound this way. It's completely counterintuitive to me and made the gameplay so much worse with every item I had to carry. I've lost count how many times I've made a mistake in this mouse button dance – dropping an object when I wanted to walk fast, or hearing the annoying bonk when the game didn't feel like allowing me to do something.

The controls are configurable, but changes are not persistent. Restarting the game brings back the defaults. What's more, the bindings menu is a pain to use – scrolling through it is slow, clicking anything resets the view so you get lost, and there's no feedback upon overriding another binding.


The opposite of speed

Since Maquette deals with variable sizes, it would be natural to include a sprint button to run through large areas. Nope! Holding Shift makes you walk slower. Why? There are exactly zero places where this is useful, as opposed to times where you fall asleep running from one area to another as a rat-sized character.


Visual and functional bugs

Dropped items most often hover above the ground, which is very noticeable on levels where you need to climb them. Good luck jumping on top of these stairs! They're unreachable, go back and place them again.

Loading a checkpoint can result in physics engine bugs, so that objects pass through the ground and there's no way to recover them. These stairs that previously were too high? Now they're underground.

There are multiple issues with objects lacking textures, polygons that fight for z-index and missing apostrophes in sentences floating around. The game also decided to ignore my mouse input after one of the numerous cutscenes, so it was yet another forced restart.


Puzzles

You know what? It's a puzzle game, so we should stop complaining about minute details such as nauseating camera, terrible controls and game-breaking bugs, and focus on puzzles!

Yay!

They're bad.

Maquette throws ideas and discards them after one use. Instead of letting the player build up an understanding of the mechanics, the game introduces a thing, expects you to immediately divine what you're supposed to do, and proceeds to another thing.

It has such a great core mechanic that it doesn't explore at all. The novelty wears off after a few minutes of playing with the sizes and there are very few puzzles that require mental effort. The objective is often not clear, so instead of wondering how to solve a puzzle, you're left wondering what is the puzzle.

It's apparent to me that the game did not go through testing (with creative testers) before release, because players are finding ways to get stuck, the only way out being a level restart. Dropping a key behind a door it's supposed to open doesn't trigger any "you dun goofed" check, and you're forced to realize that yourself.

And guess what? If you carry an object in front of you, it's larger than if you hold it to your chest. You can't fit the red crystal through the doors, but you can walk with it if you press the left mouse button first. How does that make any sense?!


Story

Nothing to write home about. It's not interesting, painfully predictable and doesn't fit the puzzles at all. If there is any connection between the plot and the maquette or traveling through recursive worlds, then I must have completely missed it. I also didn't really like the characters, but that might have been intentional.

However, I need to praise the voice actors. They did an outstanding job, so even if the script was mediocre, their delivery was remarkable – most of the dialogue carried convincing emotional load. Their acting was emphasized with nice illustrations, cutely animated to fit the content. The quality of this aspect of the game really stands out.


Finale

I was intrigued by other reviewers that praised the last chapter of the game, so I pushed forward to find out if Maquette was going to become another example of tedious game with brilliant final puzzle (like The Pedestrian). Unfortunately, even that's not the case. The mechanics change a bit, but the game continues its search for raison d'être with one-time puzzles that rely on clunky controls.

Maquette fails as a puzzle game, fails with its storytelling, and wins in voice acting. But voice acting alone won't carry a $18 title which has barely more content than its Steam screenshots show.
 
fri
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 avril 2022
高概念3D解谜。不得不说套娃3D解谜这个点子真的很棒，音乐和美术也很棒，这一切都让这个游戏的卖相看起来很棒。
但是，实际又玩起来就会发现，游戏的交互做得很糟糕，判定比较严格，引导很弱（故意做的弱引导），导致卡关的时候，你不确定到底是自己的思路错了，还是判定有问题；另外严重怀疑游戏根本没有找人试玩测试，试错成本太高，解谜1分钟，跑路3分钟，明明加一个一键返回或者多一些存档点就能解决。
另外游戏体量很小，所有谜题加起来不超过20个，即使多次试错，总流程也不会超过5小时。
还有，我讨厌在解谜游戏里加入计时挑战成就，想不出什么好成就可以不做。

the story is interesting, I wish it were longer though, maybe had a different perspective or a followup?

8.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
Это скорее визуальная новелла, чем игра в общем понимании. Механика с манипуляцией размерами объектов очень напомнило VR проект A Fisherman's Tale, но там из-за VR игровой опыт на голову выше чем в Maquette. В остальном в игре приятная графика, отличная музыка, простенькие головоломки, плюсом идет наличие саббов на русском.

В общем игра с неба звезд не хватает, но если вы ищите не напряжного геймплея на пару тройку часов, то Maquette вам вполне подойдет.

882 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

Avec un concept aussi original et Annapurna Interactive comme éditeur, on était en droit de s’attendre à une petite pépite dans le monde des puzzles game. La déception n’en est que plus grande. Maquette avait tout ce qu’il fallait pour marquer les esprits: un concept génial, une direction artistique sublime et des doubleurs talentueux. Et pourtant, une fois manette en main, le jeu perd toute saveur, la faute à un nombre trop grand d’approximations. La maniabilité s’avère trop rigide pour être agréable et apporte son lot de frustration. Et c’est sans compter l’écriture, mièvre à souhait, qui rappelle les pires heures de la tragi-comédie romantique. De l’équilibre entre jeu narratif et puzzle game aurait pu naître un savoureux mélange, à condition de savoir tirer le meilleur parti des deux genres. Grateful Decay loupe le coche avec Maquette, pourtant doté d’un énorme potentiel.


Pour lire le test entier, ça se passe ici: https://www.jeuxvideo-live.com/jeux-video/test-maquette-1879
 
DonBear
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
8.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2021
I REALLY wanted to like this game: its core mechanic is brilliant and well-executed, and the puzzles are generally challenging without being frustrating (with the exception of the key puzzle in The Spiral), and the graphics are gorgeous. There are some frustrating crash-to-desktop bugs, though, and some weird POV-locking and stuttering that occurs when manipulating in-game objects.

Unfortunately, I hated the music. The first song was fun, the second one was awful, and then the third one was so jarringly loud I turned the volume all the way down and didn't turn it back up again until the next cut-scene. And since I'm the kind of person who collects video game soundtracks, this is a major, major turn-off for me.

But the worst is the storyline threading the whole thing together. I hated both characters and their relationship just felt stilted and forced, and the inevitable break-up was incredibly ham-handed. I'm glad they didn't get back together by the end. Good riddance.


So... yeah. This same mechanic employed in a game with a less obnoxious soundtrack and a less hackneyed, overwrought plot? Yes, please.

DO buy this game if you like challenging, mind-bending puzzles, never get tired of Hallmark movies no matter how awful the scripting is, and enjoy the audio aesthetic of Sara Bareilles.

DON'T buy this game if you can't stand warble-sprite-hipster-coffee-bar music or if you prefer plotlines that aren't lazy clichés.
 
cleothemuse

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 février 2023
BEAR IN MIND: There is apparently a game-breaking bug towards the end of this game. I and others were able to get around it by restarting the level, but some weren't so lucky, so keep this in mind when buying and for this reason (as well as in general) I'd recommend getting this at a steep sale. Unless you somehow get really, really emotionally invested, then the last few minutes aren't so special that you'll feel really cheated out of the experience, though. (Imho the really cool ♥♥♥♥ is a couple levels before that.)

So that said: I really enjoyed the gameplay and the physics. I managed to escape the Maquette to game-breaking levels, repeatedly, and had a great time with that. There's an eeriness to being in the larger versions that the game really leans into, and I found most of the physics-based puzzles clever, but arranging things in the smallest Maquette (and even in the larger one) can be really finicky (especially if you're engineering a plan to escape to places the game emphatically doesn't want you to go). I had some nice little "aha!" moments and some times I had to check a walkthrough (I kept forgetting you can technically achieve goals in any size of Maquette) and the later levels actually get incredibly spectacular. There's a specific image that will absolutely haunt me (in a good way) and no doubt be a source of inspiration in the future.

That said, there's like...a story to this? With some kind of a romance? Idk, it seems to have absolutely nothing to do with the Maquette except as a physical representation of the world created by the characters' relationship, but it's honestly so loosely connected that it feels like the story got slapped on top of the gimmick in a hurry. I like the sketching motif, and how the drawings change to reflect the characters' emotional perspectives, and maybe if it had gone a little deeper with the story or created a way to more clearly tie the relationship to the level design then I would like it more. As it stands though, it's a really good idea for a game that could definitely be more fleshed out in its execution, and a really boring story that seems to be trying to Dear Esther a game that doesn't need it. I'm reminded of Mind: Path to Thalamus, which had the same entrancing visuals paired with a story that I absolutely could not have cared less about.

Tl;dr: Play it for the visuals and the gimmick, it's not for people who need a well-rounded story with their game, and be mindful of the game-breaking bug.
 
Ax
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 novembre 2022
很有特点的解密游戏，流程很短，本人三个小时不到就通关了。
整体难度中等，极少部分谜题需要脑洞与制作组合拍，否则大概率卡关。 （比如第三章临近结尾取出红球、第六章缩放钥匙、第七章拱门冲刺）

画面总的来说意境还是很足的，而且起到了简介体现剧情的作用。

剧情很简单，用场景、CG、字幕、语音等多种方式结合讲了个不圆满但朴实完整的故事。不过，游戏里貌似没有说明白玩家一直身处的解密场景，为什么会出现、跟剧情有何关系。

推荐价格，解密爱好者原价尚可，其余建议打折入。
PS：对于喜欢这类“大场景小场景套娃”类解密游戏的玩家，推荐一款VR游戏“A Fisherman's Tale”（Steam好评率93%）

Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
At the start of the game, I was worried the plot could turn out to be about yet another depressed teenager. Fortunately, it isn't. Maquette feels like a mix of What Remains of Edith Finch and Superliminal but features its own creative mechanics too.

It's rather interesting how the sketchbook pages take form in the maquette, and the puzzles are very intuitive, although not too easy either. You'd expect a game like this to be easy to softlock or glitch, but they've done a great job checking whether there are invisible walls where needed, and sometimes going out of bounds is even part of the puzzle. Oh, and the soundtrack is fantastic.
 
Strawblaze
1,062 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mars 2021
Maquette's beautiful aesthetics and a fascinating central mechanic is ultimately let down by lack of depth in either direction. The product results in an unpolished, linear walking adventure where the author shares a personal love tale that fails to transcend to a universal theme.

Traversing the world and exploring begins exciting and full of potential, but the player is rarely rewarded for this exploration. More often than not, the player is punished with flat, expansive areas that have no visual design to indicate accessible paths. Invisible barriers and transparent, unfinished textures are common. Twice I was forced to reload an area: once after exploring some ruins and finding myself stuck in geometry and once after accidentally hitting a trigger through a wall and soft-locking.

Accompanying this is a folk score that plays upon hitting key checkpoints. Despite being a fan of this genre, the lyric-heavy music feels entirely unfamiliar and out of place in this sort of game.

All told, this is a pass. Look instead at the much better and highly polished inspirations for this game: The Witness, Outer Wilds, Antichamber, and Portal all surpass Maquette.
 
Sastopher

Produit reçu gratuitement

I really enjoyed Maquette. The puzzles are absolutely brilliant, it's a really cool concept, and the game is short enough that it doesn't outstay its welcome. I love these kind of cheap, short, interesting games that explore a novel concept like this. To be honest the story was kind of bland, but it didn't really get in the way of the puzzles so 🤷‍♀️. It may not be up there with like, Portal or Talos Principle or the Witness, but it's still a cool, well-made puzzle game that's worth playing.

Non recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 décembre 2021
Maquette didn't lose me right away. I was drawn in by the promise of an interesting story, really good music, and puzzle mechanics with lots of potential. The first thing that took me out of it was how poorly the game runs. My computer can run much more graphically high-end games than this, but Maquette had a choppy framerate and multiple crash bugs for me, and the game stutters when it transitions to cutscene. As I played through the rest of the game, the rest of the promising elements lost their luster. The music only lasts for a couple of minutes on every level before being replaced by ambience. The story is relatable, but relatability doesn't immediately make a story interesting, and the story of Maquette is not interesting at all.

7.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
Игра сыровата. Она НЕ плохая, но и хорошей назвать её сложно. Приятная глазу графика, хорошая волшебная музыка.
История любви интересна вначале, как и диалоги её повествующие. Но потом и диалоги и история скатываются в нечто, чему очень сложно сопереживать.
Игра сама создаёт правила и сама же их нарушает, но не позволяет при этом нарушать эти правила тебе. Постоянные "невидимые стены", невозможность подняться по немного увеличившемуся углу подъёма. В игре тебя заставляют пройти загадку только исключительно заранее определённым разработчиками способом и очень часто ты не можешь отклониться от него даже на чуть-чуть. Игра хочет доминировать над тобой.
Куски истории иногда остаются без перевода.
Ты запросто можешь застрять в дизайне уровня.
Отвратительный гейм дизайн, хоть и интересные иногда загадки.

А мне зашла игра. Чередуются головоломки с сюжетным повествованием. Повествование идет в виде некоторых отрывков зарисовок и фраз, которые по факту подсказывают тебе, что ты идешь в верном направлении. Приятная рисовка, шикарное музыкальное сопровождение. 1,193 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2021
I had to sit on writing this review for a few weeks before finally deciding to do it because it feels bad to write a negative review for a game which is so close to being excellent.

Firstly, there is so much to praise about Maquette. The visuals, the music, the voice acting, the general story, the creativity - there are a lot of things it does exceptionally well. The art direction in particular is fantastic, and there are a lot of moments which are genuinely stunning - especially near the beginning, as well as towards the end. The way it incorporates full-band music as well as emotive, believable voice acting truly brings the story it wants to tell to life. Honestly, if i was watching someone play this game, I would have no issue 1000% recommending it without issue.

However, I played it. And it had a ton of issues.

There were multiple times where I got completely soft-locked - key objects clipping through the ground, getting trapped in rooms, etc. Though, when it comes to getting trapped, near the end of the game they tell you to hold Triangle (on a PS4 controller) to reset to the center of the level - this would have been great to know during the tutorial, because I had to reset multiple times and lost tons of progress along the way. I'd tried every button on the controller to try and reset, but wasn't aware of the hold. Though, ultimately that's my fault, again if it had been present during the tutorial rather than only showing up during the last 20 minutes, it would have made a huge difference.

Beyond that, the controls were supremely bad in certain spots - especially in the latter half of the game. Some puzzles demanded far more precision than the systems allowed for, and beyond that, doing simple actions like rotation of objects started having effects on the player character. Things like doing a few rotations making the character randomly teleport, and also when moving the object in question, sometimes it would flip the camera around so that you constantly had to re-orient yourself.

There were many more issues I encountered of this nature, but the point is that finishing the game was actively unpleasant in the last few hours - which is really unfortunate for a relatively short game. Now, to be noted, I played the game on launch day and have not replayed it since patches were issued, so I cannot offer any insight as to whether these problems have since been ironed out. If they have, then I would recommend it; but I can only express my experience with the game, and while I greatly enjoyed parts of it, there was just too much struggle to truly enjoy it.

In short, it's a really great game which is unfortunately encased within a fairly bad game. I do hope that patches can improve the encountered issues; but as it stands from my personal experience, I cannot recommend Maquette.
 
Mom's Spaghetti にゃん
514 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2022
First, the primary reason I would not recommend this game: It's clearly labeled for full controller support. While it could've worked for some people, I and others had a bug where it would not accept button input. Rebinding doesn't work either since the developer used incorrect input settings. From Discussions posts, it sounds like the cause was identified by users but this wasn't addressed by the dev in the year+ since release.

The game's charming enough, with a couple of clever puzzles, but not much that hasn't been done before and, arguably, better. Maquette seems to be, itself, a model or toy meant to contain the story they wanted to tell. Honestly, a couple of story segments felt on point and packed a punch, but on the whole started to feel trite and forced.

A puzzle game shouldn't force a middling story on a player and a story/experience game shouldn't have puzzles this finicky. While it's mostly good at guiding objects to correct orientations, the times when it's not make me somewhat relieved I couldn't play with a controller.

Overall, I can't recommend this to people at full price, but at a deep discount playing through the first few levels might be worth the price of admission.

Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 février 2022
A fantastic and beautiful puzzle game, with a unique recursive mechanic that feels like a fresh new challenge, just like the best puzzle games have. In order to solve any puzzle, you'll need to think outside the box in terms of scale and well, recursion. It also has a gorgeous mind-bending setting that fits the gameplay perfectly. And, it's all tied by a touching and relatable story about a relationship.

Don't miss out on this one, it's one of the most unique puzzlers you'll find on Steam.

Évaluation publiée le 14 avril 2023
Overall, I enjoyed Maquette a lot. The environments and visual effects are quite interesting. The puzzles were a good mix of ideas. I couldn't figure out a couple of them, but the ones I did figure out left me feeling all kinds of proud of myself. I'm glad you can mute the music. If there was a story-free game mode, it would have been twice as good. It seemed like every time I was really starting to enjoy myself, there would be a snippet of someone's failing relationship that I would have to suffer through before I could continue. Why would you build a game around a failing relationship?!?! It's such a downer and I don't know or care about the random people having the trouble anyway. Totally weird and annoying.
 
Zero Calvin
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
Não me cativou. É um ótimo jogo, a mecânica de recursividade é legal e interessante, mas não consigo recomendar. Apesar de eu ter curtido o tempo que passei jogando ele, não foi o suficiente deixar uma análise positiva.

O enredo é simplezinho mas segue uma narrativa um tanto quanto descompassada. Senti o diálogo na maior parte das vezes sem emoção (mesmo com a interpretação excelente dos atores), sem charme, sem carisma. Alguns momentos parecia que algo interessante iria acontecer, mas é tudo bem sem sal. Tudo corre num ritmo esquisito, é a forma como consigo descrever. Eu sinto que foi um potencial perdido, mas pode ser que te agrade se você se identificar com as situações que o casal passa.

Os puzzles tem seus altos e baixos. Em momentos eu achei o uso das mecânicas muito criativas e únicas, com bom uso do poder de observação do jogador, mas em outros chega a ser horrível, sem lógica ou pouco intuitivo. Os "a-há moment" dessas partes ruins são mais "era isso que era pra fazer?" do que satisfatório. Tem horas que a solução parece ser algo que "bugaria" o jogo (vou dar um exemplo: durante os primeiros capítulos tem uma parede invisível envolvendo o mapa inteiro que não deixa você pular o muro pro lado de "fora". Capítulos depois uma das soluções vai ser justamente você pular esse muro. Como intuitivamente eu fiquei condicionado a "pular o muro = out of bounds", não fiquei confiante em pular o muro quando era justamente a solução).

Apesar de tudo isso o jogo é uma boa experiência. Os cenários são lindos, a arte é excelente, as músicas são muito boas também. Os momentos bons dos puzzles e essa mecânica bem diferente fazem a jogatina ter valido a pena num geral. Porém se você busca walking simulators com bons puzzles ou com boa narrativa, tem obras bem muito melhores como por exemplo Superliminal ou What Remains of Edith Finch.
 
raphadura

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2021
美术不错，音乐不错。故事深度不深，但将一场平凡的恋爱，描绘的有声有色，悲欢离合，尽入眼帘。
可以看得出游戏的核心是递归解谜，然后才有了别的，后期也能感觉的出设计者对玩法升级的尝试

美中不足的是它的引导和场景互动。
一般的铁栅栏没法让物体穿过，让我惯性思维后，又出现了一个需要穿铁栅栏的谜题。
引导方面游戏尝试了动画、在关键处放特效和空气墙的方法，大体上没问题但小细节有缺失，例如有些管卡可以通过放大物体跳关，打乱了关卡顺序，造成了一定程度的混乱。

作为一个团队不大的独立游戏，我觉得游戏完成度可以，暂且给个好评。但推荐价格可能得-10%，推荐先加愿望单
 
LS
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
4.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2021
This kinda sucks to write, because I was really pulling for this game to live up to what I was wanting it to be, but it just kinda didn't. First off, the game doesn't really feel nice to play. I get that it's a bit hard to get player movement down, especially when things are changing size constantly, but this game just generally feels clunky to play. Ultimately, it really focuses straight in on the story, which would be fine, aside from the fact that I knew almost exactly what was going to happen pretty much from the start. I kept waiting for it to subvert my expectations, but it just didn't. Because of the ways that the environment reflects the story, I really could've seen this game being a really good one if they just straight up removed the voices and writing from the game. There are a ton of symbols that could've made the story satisfying to figure out and piece together, instead of one that disappoints with its simplicity. The puzzles are unfortunately pretty one-note. There are also many points where the game has solutions that are unbelievably easy, but incredibly frustrating to figure out, which I would attribute to the many distractions within the area you're in at any given point. It's absolutely a really pretty game, but it just feels like it doesn't fit the game that was created around it. It's definitely hard not to focus on the negatives, especially because I generally would say that I had an alright time with this game. In terms of things it does well, I'd say that the voice acting is pretty alright, as well as the music. Obviously the visuals are pretty nice, and the basic idea behind all the puzzles is solid. The problems arise when the game tries to force its strengths into the rest of the game, which just ends up feeling really awkward.

Overall, I would honestly probably say it's an alright game. But I would say with pretty solid certainty that this game doesn't live up to the marketing or the price tag.
 
wiwu

Évaluation publiée le 23 mars 2021
This could've been great, but it wasn't.

This is a walking simulator with a dull story (I was yawning the whole time, and holding W didn't help with that).
The gimmick is not utilised in any challenging manner (it's mainly for placing objects at 3 different scales), and objects can easily get stuck on other objects, which makes interactions awkward and annoying.
The exploration is unrewarding since the world is empty bar the floating text. I've tried to find something interesting to look at, but have gotten only extra minutes of walking, at times in complete silence.

Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

There were a lot of things I did not like in the first chapters of the game - there was a lot of guessing about what to do and where to go which I think needed a bit more consideration. Later, when I figured out how the maquette works that was not an issue. I enjoyed the puzzles but I would like if there was more of them.

I did not care for the story, it was uninteresting. Voice acting was good but the script was a bit generic. I get the relation of the environment to the story but it was all on the nose. The music choice was unusual for a video game but much like other things in this game. The last level - the exchange - was probably the best but it also crashed a bunch in that one.

If you were let down by Superliminal or Manifold Garden like I was, this is how it should've been done.

Non recommandé
7.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2021
I really want to like this game. It's a cool concept, the potential is huge, and for about 20% of the game, they nailed it.

For the other 80% of the game, they totally missed the mark.

TLDR: Polish drops off significantly after the first level or two. There are tons of invisible walls (in fact, the final puzzle is just an invisible wall on a staircase with a subpar puzzle, abruptly ending the game with frustration and no real closure (they literally don't tell you this btw, you just have to figure out that an otherwise totally walkable staircase is blocked for the sake of the puzzle with zero indication), collision is all over the place, and frankly it feels like a cash grab for them to be releasing this game in this state.

Only buy this game if you're willing to overlook the fact that the game really isn't done and in this stage is more frustrating than fun. If you're looking for a fairly run of the mill emotional story told in beautifully drawn cutscenes surrounded by incomplete levels and bad gameplay, this is the game for you. Otherwise, take a pass.


To put it bluntly, this should really be an early access release. There are tons of invisible walls, many places where you can see through gaps between models and terrain. Speaking of which, the terrain is janky with tons of places where you can walk where you shouldn't, and others where you can't walk where you really should be able to.

This game starts off really strong, super atmospheric. I'm not normally into these kind of emotional story games, but the mechanics were enough to draw me in.

But once you get through the first level or so, the polish drops off and the cracks begin to show up.

Most of the puzzles require noticing a tiny detail (for example, the shape of a fence so you can pass a crystal through it, or that there is a dim light on an inaccessable ledge). These aren't puzzles. They are filler so the game feels like more than it is.

Beyond that, I can't help but feel a bit railroaded. All the levels tend to have one item at a time, which you use on one puzzle, which has one answer. There are few real puzzles in this game, the rest are either incredibly easy, or like mentioned above, aren't actually puzzles. Basically, the game railroads you the entire time.

I expected to have lots of cool adventures using the size changing, but it's mostly reserved for items and when you do change size, it's just to walk from point A to point B. I thought I'd be walking through lots of nooks in houses, along rafters and other similar things like in games such as Chibi Robo, Minish Cap and really any RPG where you have size changing and puzzles. Nah, almost none of that, and where there is some, it's just, 'Enter crack in wall, collect item, walk out and get big again.' The potential is huge for all sorts of cool things, but sadly, the game just doesn't do any of them somehow. Being tiny should be cool, in this game, it's just a chore.

Not to mention the controls are god awful. Trying to put down items is a nightmare. The game has a mechanic where you can't put down an item if it doesn't fit, but like all other elements of the game, it's totally inaccurate and often won't let you place things. In addition, you can't place items down near places they activate (there is a level centered around using crystals to pass forcefields, if your crystal is less than a mile from the forcefield, good luck putting it down).

At this point, I've written more than most people would read and haven't even scratched the surface. If you've read this far, I suggest you just watch a lets play, you'll get waaaaay more out of it than actually playing through the game itself.
 
Roboson
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
Thumb very slightly down -- definitely a title where I wish Steam's review system had more granularity than just thumbs up or thumbs down.

The good:

* very pretty
* nifty concept for a 3d puzzler
* nice music (dunno if it's original for the game?)

The meh:

* very short game
* the framing story was *eyeroll* -- game would've been better without it
* walk speed at higher, uh, zoom levels was painfully slow -- holding shift should've doubled your speed instead of halving it (never needed to go slower)

The bad:

* positioning controls for objects were frustratingly titchy for a couple puzzles
* BUGS -- ran into three (objects getting stuck in "place" mode, except it wouldn't let me drop them or pull them back, necessitating a reload; on the final level, hitting F sometimes put me under the dome instead of inside it, requiring a restart; and, worst of all, a lever on the final lever failed to work properly, and I wasted a bunch of time before looking it up and learning it was a bug, necessitating a reastart)

All told, some cool ideas in it, but not enough real meat to it. Probably spent three "real" hours finishing it (discounting the time wasted on bugs or AFK), which would've been two if I'd been able to run faster.

Once the fix some of the bugs, it'll be worth a look, but IMHO it's a stretch at $20. Would be a good $10 game, assuming you're into funky puzzlers and/or overly mopey walking simulators.
 
chmod1777

Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
とりあえず一周したのでレビュー
一周にかかる時間は4時間くらいでしょうか。
「再帰性パズル」の名の通り自分のいる空間を模した
ジオラマに物を配置したり動かすことで、実際に空間に変化が起きることを利用して
さまざまなパズルを解いていくゲームです。

面白いのが模型の上で操作しているとき
動かしている物体がリアルタイムで現実に反映されており
外側で動いてるのが実際に見えて
非常によくできたゲームだと感心しました！

ストーリーはある一組の男女の出会いから始まる物語を
思い出していく中でそれに関連するジオラマがパズルになる形で
描かれており、違和感なく楽しめました。

パズルも複雑な操作なしで気づけば解けるちょうどよい難易度で
すっきりプレイできました。

少しボリュームが足りないようにも感じましたが
その点はギミックの面白さで充分カバーできていると思います。

総じてこの手のパズル好きにはお勧めのゲームです！

This was a unique game. I went into it thinking it was like superliminal due to the trailer, but it is honestly its own thing.
While solving puzzles you are hearing snippets of a relationship between two individuals, and it tells their story while you play the game.

Évaluation publiée le 25 mars 2021
A very beautifully designed short game; in terms of story, style and music.

Very reminiscent of Superliminal, but does not expand on the gameplay elements to the same extent.
Expect a more watered-down, walking experience in terms of gameplay.
Overall still very fun with decent replay-ability.

Maquette is definitely more story-centric than similar games in its class.
The story being the main focus it starts of cringy but ends up being quite beautiful not only in story but also in artstyle and its absolutely fantastic music. It also offers speedrunning opportunities similar to other games in its class which is quite fun.

Overall would definitely recommend if you enjoy short stories with an added element of unique gameplay that focuses on challenging the way you approach obstacles.

Évaluation publiée le 16 juillet 2023
Love the story, voice acting, music, and game mechanics. The controls can get frustrating in parts and it can lead you to miss solutions to the puzzles.

The game is beautiful and the recursive puzzle design is great. The ability to switch between different levels is brilliant and leads to some fantastic eureka moments.

The only complaint I have is with the controls. When placing items, they will get stuck on geometry and land slightly off. The jumping is very restrictive; making it feel like you can't make jumps. It seems to have a large horizontal length, but a small height and in some places jumping just doesn't work. Missed a solution because of that weird jump arc. Finally, it would be helpful if there was a run button. Sometimes my walk speed would accelerate and then slow to a crawl for seemingly no reason.

Non recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
it just feels pretty raw and amateurish on many levels.
first, the story is completely forgettable and has nothing to do with the game. it seems that now "solve some puzzles - get fed some cheap unrelated story dialog" is almost a de facto standard in "indy puzzlers", and i hate it. manifold garden worked just fine without a story, or if you feel the game absolutely must have one, make it fit the game.
but i would totally forgive any story missteps of the gameplay was great. unfortunately, it's not quite there. it's often hard to tell an intended solution from an unintended one. one can see how they tried to twist the consistency of the rules to enforce their "correct" solutions, often failing and only encouraging the player to seek a way to break them (well, at least in my case). for instance, an object you hold won't push other objects - unless those objects are still moving. so you want to push one crystal with another? just make one crystal move and push it before it falls asleep. there's the usual staff like invisible walls, things you can or can't jump on, etc. overall, control feels very imprecise and janky. i think i only liked one puzzle (the one with 3 keys), and it was in the final chapter, which deviates from the general "maquette" formula. like the others said, the world-within-a-word mechanic does feel underexplored, but i'm actually not sure if there are ways to make more of it than they did, at least when the world it static. possibly it's just shallow past the initial wow.
generally, i feel that superliminal explored similar concepts better.
 
rumpelstiltskin
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mars 2021
TL;DR: Maquette has wonderful world design and neat puzzles, but the story falls flat and the sparse content may not live up to the price point. If you like puzzle games and walking simulators, you’ll probably have a good time! If you’re looking for anything other than those exact two things, you’re unlikely to find good value in this.

Maquette is a puzzle/walking game that attempts to take the player on a physical journey through the emotional lifespan of a shattered relationship. You are guided by the words of the man remembering it, Michael, and solve puzzles to make your way through worlds that he and his partner, Kenzie, once imagined together.

These worlds are easily the best aspect of Maquette. They’re colorful, imaginative, varied and cinematic, and even though it requires a great deal of walking back and forth through them, I rarely tired of the many unique vistas on offer.

In these levels the world is recursive, meaning that there is a smaller copy of the world inside the one you’re in, as well as a larger one outside of it. They do some neat things with this concept, and the puzzles, though somewhat sparse, do have cool moments. There is a notable lack of guidance which can be frustrating, but I didn’t run across anything I couldn’t puzzle out within a few minutes of experimenting.

I ran into a few bugs, mostly harmless visual issues, but there were some terrain clipping issues, and a puzzle in the second to last level that was very glitchy when placing objects. Remember that you can press and hold F to teleport back to the center of the level! The game would also stutter for a few frames whenever I triggered a story event, and my computer is no slouch (i7-8700K, RX 5700XT, 32GB RAM) so it seems to still need some optimizations.

I am an avid puzzle fan, and no stranger to walking-simulator type games, but I will say I felt a bit lukewarm on this one. First off, it is short. It took me 4 hours to complete the story, and I took my time. Somehow though, it still felt empty. The puzzles and story bits often act more as breadcrumbs leading you on long walks through levels than as the real meat of the game.

Maquette starts out story-heavy and puzzle-light at the start and slowly shifts that balance the other direction as you progress. Some earlier puzzles can be simple to the point of tedious, but there were satisfying challenges in later sections. Nothing on par with a Portal or a Talos Principle, but a solid showing, nonetheless.

The story on the other hand, is the same level of lukewarm the entire way through. The voice acting is great, but the writing is trite and predictable, and by the end I was largely indifferent to the narrator’s emotional journey. Turns out that immaturity and poor communication skills destroy relationships. Who knew?

The real tragedy of this story is in how this stale narrative causes the game to sabotage itself. The conceit is that the world reflects the events and emotional arcs of the story, but these environments end up telling a far more compelling tale than the story they are meant to reflect. The breathtaking worlds of infinite scale are undermined by the banal writing, and the story’s blandness is in turn dwarfed by the emotion of the world built to convey it.

I did enjoy my time with Maquette! I think it has fantastic visual design and innovative puzzle concepts that keep the game afloat despite the dead weight of the narrative. If it sounds up your alley, wait for a sale and give it a shot! Either way, thanks for reading!
 
Splintercat
353 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2022
A totally fine little game.
Its very pretty and has some interesting puzzles, but its kind of half puzzle game half walking simulator. It has a cute little story about a relationship, but is more focused on the feelings and experiences of relationship beginning and troubles than having much to say about that experience, so depending on your taste that may be cool gel well with the atmosphere or may seem thin and make it seem to drag between puzzles.
Also its very linear, it doesn't necessarily introduce some mechanics well (like crystals removing colored fences, y'know like they do), and can swing without warning from conceptual puzzle to just a jumping puzzle, so a wiki can be handy for not getting frustrated.
But a nice little game for 3-4 hours. Neat, but not spectacular.
 
somebody2152

Évaluation publiée le 29 mars 2021
Un peu cher la promenade...

On est loin des expériences proposées par certains Puzzle Games.

J'avais de bonnes attentes pour ce jeu, les décors m'avaient l'air magnifiques et les énigmes sympas. Finalement les décors sont beaux ça oui, mais le reste est vide et répétitif (il n'y a que deux ou trois éléments interactifs à chaque fois). La zone est principalement la même pour les 3/4 du jeu avec quelques variantes, seuls les derniers chapitres innovent un peu. C'est sympa les 3 premiers chapitres et ensuite c'est agaçant car les mécaniques sont toujours les mêmes et n'ont parfois aucun sens.

Dommage d'avoir des scènes aussi belles que la fête foraine, les jardins, le centre-ville pour finalement juste s'y promener et ne pas les exploiter.

Sans parler des problèmes de collisions des objets, la maniabilité parfois catastrophique de ces derniers pour les poser... plusieurs fois, pour arriver à sauter (terrible game design) sur l'objet et accéder à la zone voulu et enfin à la suite du jeu... dont l'histoire ne vous apportera pas grand chose non plus.

Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
When purchasing Maquette I expected new types of puzzles because of the recursion effect - which I got: Most of the riddles weren't two hard once you understand the concept but a few of them took a bit longer to figure out. All of them were interesting and different compared to other games I played.
But what I didn't expect was the deep emotional story of a relationship whose mood is reflected in the color and structures of each chapter. The soundtrack adds a lot to that.
I would have loved if the game was a bit longer though (took me 4,5 hours for the first playthrough and 2,5 hours to get the missing achievments) but I defintely recommend it to everyone who likes storytelling and puzzle games!

Évaluation publiée le 19 juillet 2022
overall I recommend. the gameplay is great and the puzzles, while short were alright and presented enough of a challenge to be a puzzle but not enough to be obscure. the game was very short (whole game completed in 2.4 hours with me being distracted and alt+tabbing often) but the quality is there and I don't think I regret spending the full price on it.

the story was very cliche and I didn't really understand how it interacted with the environments of some of the puzzles, I would have been skipping the forced cutscenes but... they're forced... and don't include any kind of skip function and remove your ability to bring up the pause menu while playing which is just honestly very annoying as I really just wanted to play the puzzles because the concept was cool. other than that the story is passable, dialogue is written well enough and the voice acting was very well done IMO.

there were a few times where I was able to softlock myself just due to how I was exploring the game as well as getting stuck in between some geometry of a puzzle element and a wall. the game only tells you about the reset key in the final level so I had to restart from checkpoint and lost a couple minutes of progress, definitely a minus but the game autosaved enough to where it wasn't an issue to restart from the last "checkpoint" for me. (I also found a way to escape the map completely and found that there's only three layers you can actually walk on before falling out of the world)

1,854 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2023
Как только я узнал о Maquette, я сразу добавил игру в список желаемого, а после прохождения без сомнений добавил в избранное. Нынешнюю смешанную оценку я не принимаю, так как у меня от игры остались только положительные впечатления.

Ключевой составляющей Maquette ожидаемо являются взрывающие мозг физико-математические механики, что я очень люблю и уважаю. Причём я ещё нигде не видел такой вложенности пространства в себя самого! При попытке вспомнить что-то подобное в голову почему-то приходят The Room 4: Old Sins, DYO и Manifold Garden, но эти игры абсолютно не похожи по визуальному стилю и настроению.

А второй важной составляющей игры оказалась рассказываемая эмоциональная история. Обычно я недоволен головоломками, на которые натягивают поверхностный сюжет и вставляют псевдофилософские размышления, но конкретно тут авторы всё сделали очень грамотно, несмотря на минимализм. Не знаю, в чём секрет их успеха, но посмею предположить, что дело в игре актёров озвучивания и саундтреке.

По-настоящему меня смущало только ожидание багов и достижения на спидран уровней. Но у меня был только пара вылетов на последнем уровне, с которыми несложно справиться, заглянув в обсуждения сообщества. А прохождение на скорость даже разжигает интерес из-за адекватных лимитов времени.

Я многого ожидал и многое получил. Интересная задумка, добротная реализация и взрослое содержание заслуживают 9 подсолнушков из 10.
 
Zhareg
573 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
14.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
I was super excited for this game, and immediately purchased and downloaded it as soon as it was possible on Steam. I grew up with games that used to be called "adventure games" but today are generally labelled "walking simulators". 'Myst' was the first computer game I played and ended up being hugely influential on my gaming tastes along with its sequel 'Riven' and then the forgotten classic 'Obsidian'.

So obviously a game like 'Maquette' immediately piqued my interest and I waited and watched for any updates on it that I could find, especially after finishing 'The Witness', I needed something to fill that adventure/walking/puzzle game void that was left.

'Maquette' starts out wonderfully and bursting full of character and promise. The visuals are stellar and never get repetitive, and the puzzles ramp up in difficulty very nicely. The thinking behind the mechanics are well thought out and solutions were many times surprising and unexpected. Also the music selections were distinctive matching well to the DIY/sketchbook-style visuals and sound design were a nice surprise and high quality. The only criticism I have of the gameplay is some out of left-field 'platforming' type sections (using jumping to get to different platforms) that come out of nowhere and seemed so different to the rest of the puzzles that they stood out poorly and what made it worse was the controls are not well suited to platforming. But other than some weird platforming sections, the recursive nature of the puzzles is truly magnificent and the visuals are surreal, painterly and add such incredible depth to the puzzles themselves.

Unfortunately the gorgeous visuals and fascinating puzzle mechanics are tied to a story that is cloyingly maudlin and predictable. I played this game with my husband and we were both able to predict the exact story beats the script hits. I don't mind a romance story at all, but this was painfully rote. The story starts out fine, and is a nice meet-cute story that is injected with personality and vibrancy via Bryce Dallas-Howard and Seth Gabel's natural chemistry in the voice acting. But, by around the halfway point the story flat-lines hard to painful predictability and not even their considerable acting talent can defibrillate it back to life.

Which was just such a damn shame. Had this game employed a writer that didn't rely on simplistic sappy cliches, or banal romcom characterization and could meet the creativity of the puzzles and visuals this game would have been truly something special. As it stands, I will still recommend it to people due to the ingenious idea of the central puzzle mechanic and creative beautiful visuals but it will come with a huge asterisk disclaimer to ignore the story and come up with your own because it will be infinitely better than what you're presented with in the game.

SCORE: 6.5 / 10
 
ShinHito
227 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mars 2021
I am so deeply disappointed in this game. Absolutely gorgeous art direction with buggy, jerky controls, extremely simple puzzles (except when you miss a hint or the mechanics aren't functioning correctly), an under-utilized recursion mechanic blended with an extremely bland relationship story that's overly drawn out with long, simply-animated cutscenes with voiceover. Feels like the game is 15% basic puzzles and 85% generic relationship story. I've been following this game for almost a year now and it's such a letdown.
 
staciarain
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
一手好牌，堪堪及格

前言

作为一个解密游戏，本作称不上是一个优秀的作品。甚至可以说是一个很糟糕的一个作品了，因为作为一个基本不晕 3D 的 FPS 玩家，玩了半个小时之后就差点想吐。只能勉强玩半个小时歇一会，堪堪打通几章之后，对剧情游戏有了个大概的了解印象。所以说，本测评充斥着主观评价和想法，还有对眩晕的报复性心理。

游戏介绍

游戏是通过一个个的日常小故事来推进剧情，不得不说这种真实系的现代爱情故事真的很吸引人，而游戏主要的解密要素都是在剧情推进过程中。揭开一个小谜题就开始一个新的小故事，来到一个新的场景，然后又有了一个新的谜题。谜题设置都很新颖，解密方式是传统的那种 「扫地图-收集线索-获得关键道具」 的模式，不过不同的是收集线索的方式和关键道具/关卡的设计。

优缺点吐槽

优点

其他大部分优点上面都说差不多了，就简单总结一下：

1. 画面不错，3D 的效果还行，远看起来后还是很精细的，不过架不住细看；
2. 解密方式很新颖，控制模型来映射到现实场景，可以说是很新鲜的体验了；
3. 游戏剧本很普通很简单，但是演出方式很棒。演出效果上，剧情穿插和沉浸感做得不错。

缺点

怎么说呢，俗话说应该是 「瑜不掩瑕」。优点很明显但是缺点也很明显。

1. 画面确实不错，但是 3D 的操作方式真的绝了，3D 第一视角游戏最怕什么？迷路！来来回回的折腾实在是心累，有时候脑子不够用的，疏忽了一点小细节，那就需要来来回回的跑路，心累；
2. 然后就是不知道是因为帧数不稳定还是画面过于艳丽，本人一个常年不晕 3D 的 FPS 玩家，玩这个游戏没法坚持 30 分钟以上，加上需要来来回回跑路的话，直接狗带；
3. 俗话说 「一鼓作气，再而衰，三而竭」，再好的套路也经不起来来回回的折腾，本来一个很好的解密方式，来来回回都这样，实在是爱不起来。

————————————
欢迎关注或加入鉴赏家：蛋蛋荐游团
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35596718/
 
XiMeng

Recommandé
13.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2021
I was going to choose thumbs down and mention some of the good things and bad but I decided for thumbs up and you already read the positives. This was an OK game, but it could be really good, not great, if they fixed the controls. Half the time you feel like you are fighting with the controls. The puzzles; instead of feeling like you are figuring out the puzzle and trying to find a way to solve it, you wrack your brain for hours and then give up only to find out that the solution is a trick. The game leads you to the clues on how to solve the puzzle and then you find out that the solution is in a completely different direction. Half of the puzzles just felt like dirty rotten tricks. I still had some fun. It was fun feeling like a giant and also feeling like a Lilliputian. So in spite of all of the problems, I still say get it on sale and have some fun, maybe. Oh for some reason in the last area of the game, it froze and closed by itself every time I clicked on the small model of the red dome.
 
soyespo
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2022
I really really wanted to like this. Some of the puzzles are very clever and the storytelling and aesthetic are great.

However, this game is so frustrating in so many ways I cannot possibly recommend it. The seemingly simple controls are totally non-intuitive and really janky. There are frequently solutions that look like they should work that just don't because the janky physics arbitrarily block them from working. At certain points it feels like movement is PAINFULLY slow which means making mistakes takes forever and is extremely frustrating. The game does a really poor job of telling you what your actual objective is, since the game progresses by you just being in the right place at the right time. I have a couple times already solved the puzzle and not realized it because I didn't do the exact thing needed to trigger the cutscene. The environment frequently gets in the way of the puzzles, particularly when there is platforming involved, because it isn't clear what you will or will not be able to jump on or how far or close you need to be to interact with various elements.

Worst of all though: most of the puzzles are not fun. It is a lot of find the one place to put the object you have that makes it so you can go somewhere you haven't gone before. These kinds of puzzles are either trivially easy or basically impossible without looking up the answer.
 
The Green Machine
714 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
Produit reçu gratuitement

The game seems very confused in it's direction.
The music choices are very jarring, there were times i was just observing a new environment and music would start, and it'd just throw me out of the enjoyment completely.
I personally am very confused why the story needs to be here, it doesn't seem to have anything to do with what's happening around you, and if it's a twist narrative, it'll be apparent very late in the game, that i haven't gotten to yet.
The puzzles aren't especially innovative.

The world is extremely beautiful - this game is a lot more like a "walking simulator" than it's a puzzle game.
If you liked walking around, being fed stories and looking at things in edith finch and such, you'll likely find this cozy as well.

If you're expecting a puzzle game like Superliminal you'll be dissapointed, although it is a very entertaining game.
It's well worth your money, if you like games like these.

4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
This game bridges a story and puzzles in a 50/50 balance. It took me around 4 hours to complete. The puzzles were just the right amount of difficulty to make you think a little, but not enough to stump you and ruin the pacing of the story-telling. The concept in general was very interesting to me and fun to play through. At certain moments, the gameplay concepts really backed up the story in a neat way.

The story is about a relationship and depending on your personal past experiences, your connection to it will probably vary. It gave me a lot of bittersweet emotions and overall am very glad I chose to buy and play this game. Good job, devs!

shewdy
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 aout 2022
Dreadful.

The selling point is the size changing mechanic. It's interesting at first, but underdeveloped. You've quickly seen it all, and the next puzzles are basic, uninspired.
The meat of the game has you walking around in large lifeless spaces in search of an interactive object, then walking around plenty more in said large lifeless spaces in search of a spot to use it on.

Visuals are not that great. Motion sickness is easy to catch. The music is awful but can be piped down. Object manipulation is awful as well, but controls cannot be improved.

On top of that, you are subjected to a draining 3rd-rate narrative, a mundane relationship/breakup between two uninteresting lovebirds who keep whining through their nose.
Platitudes and gooeyness.
It left me incapable of playing more than 1 chapter per session.

Later on, the game turns into a mere walking simulator.
In maze-like environments.
The kind of cheap crap no puzzler wants to suffer, so I uninstalled.

Poor design effort, poor implementation.
 
corbo
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
+ Purdy
+ Great soundtrack
+ Great voice acting
+ Good puzzles
+ Story coupled with art and sound direction is emotionally compelling
= Story is otherwise pretty run-of-the-mill if you look at the genre of the text itself, but is not heavily represented in games
= Short, but not too short (took me about 4 hours)
= Keybinding, but not all keys
- Some of the "a ha!" moments in this game are just a bit too elusive, mainly due to cues that are a bit too subtle*
- Some of the puzzles are more "half-life 2-esque"; a little too finicky with a little too much emphasis on the physics engine to really make you feel smart**
- Near the end of the game, one of the puzzles wrestles with your controls, likely because of the aforementioned slightly jank physics coupled with indie controls

Verdict: Grab on sale

* I'm actually pretty sure I solved a puzzle or two wrong, but I have no idea from the feedback the game gave me whether or not it actually was, and I saw no hint system or a gradual emphasis on particular cues like a slow color flash, or a word becoming bold.

** One of the puzzles I figured out in like 30 seconds, but the controls were so finicky that I thought I was doing it wrong, and made the puzzle take like 10 minutes. There's a few in here like that.

Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
Maquette is a masterpiece! The voice acting, storytelling, and beautiful art style make it a joy to just wander slowly through the world. The music gives me chills every time it kicks in and the ambient sound design is top notch as well. The puzzle mechanics are interesting, but I've been too wrapped up in enjoying the experience of the game to progress far enough to really see how they're developed fully.

This is a game that makes me want to stop and smell the roses. They're lovely.

Non recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2023
WARNING, GAME IS UNBEATABLE!
Devs have known for over a year!
https://steamcommunity.com/app/762840/discussions/1/3395163747105115975/

In the last area, picking up the only thing there is to pick up, crashes the game. If it doesn't crash, the timed switch in the map does not open its door or even start the timer. The game currently is impossible to complete.

Otherwise, the first bit is fun, then it gets obscure & misleading, then there's a forced altercation between the 2 characters in the story, followed by obscure puzzles and finally the above mentioned game-breaking issues.
If this sht didn't happen, I would recommend, but for the amount of time Maquette has been released, I do not recommend buying it as these things should never have been an issue.

This is why you test you game before selling it.

*Edit
Well, I beat the game by saving after every thing clicked on. It crashed randomly with most interactions, and if you select 'Continue' after the credits, the game soft-locks and must be force-quit. Definitely do not recommend spending any money on this.
 
JolanXBL
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mai 2023
一款解谜方式很有特色但是谜题设计过于刻板的解谜游戏

《Maquette》是一款第一人称3D解谜冒险游戏。游戏的玩法很有俄罗斯套娃的感觉，在大中小3个场景里来回切换并转换道具的大小从而解开谜题。游戏玩法虽然很有特色，但是谜题设计过于刻板，场景里能互动的东西非常少并且提示性不足，有的地方很容易被卡住，因此并不适合休闲向的轻度解谜玩家。另外剧情方面也显得太过普通，就是一个情侣从相识到分手的简单故事。不过游戏画面挺精致的，角色配音也非常棒，游戏里还穿插了几首不错的英文歌，很好的烘托了气氛。所以仅推荐给特别喜爱解谜游戏的玩家们。


【简评：简述游戏优缺点和适合人群】
优点：
• 精致的画面
• 出色的配乐和完美的配音
• 有特色的解谜
• 独立游戏

缺点：
• 流程短
• 故事过于普通
• 谜题设计刻板且提示不足
• 价格高

适合玩家：
• 中度以上的解谜游戏玩家


【评分：打分以优良中差为标准辅以加减，满分100为完美】
• 画面：优。小巧精致。 本作画面如同标题，就像一个小模型般非常精致。

• 声音：优+。极其出色。 本作的配音完美，几首英文歌也很好的烘托了气氛，如果结尾再来首《Someone like you》将直接封神。

• 剧情：中-。过于普通。 本作就是一对恋人从相识到分手的普通故事，将将及格。

• 可玩性：良-。有特色但是刻板的解谜。 本作的解谜方式很有特色，要在大中小3个场景来回切换并把道具变换不同的尺寸大小从而解谜。但是谜题太过刻板单调，必须按照设定好的路线严丝合缝，另外提示性不足，导致玩家在一些很简单的地方会被卡住，这是本作最大的问题。另外游戏流程很短并且无太大的重复可玩性。

总结：良（75分）。一款解谜方式很有特色但是谜题设计过于刻板的解谜游戏。 很遗憾本作精致的画面，出色的声音以及很有特色的解谜方式无法掩盖太过普通的剧情和刻板的谜题设计。并且2-3小时的游戏流程以及过高的售价也进一步降低了普通玩家的购买欲望，所以仅推荐给那些特别喜欢解谜游戏的玩家们在打折时入手。
 
ZackLee
1,231 produits enregistrés

虽然是一个比较遗憾的结局，但却是一个不错的故事：每段恋爱的相遇和开始都充满了梦幻，但是两个人开始磨合过日子之后，总会有一些细小的摩擦，如果没有及时沟通解决好的话，最终都会不欢而散。因为不合适而没有勉强在一起的两人，回顾以前一起度过的美好时光，还是会心生暖意。
非常现实的故事，就是3D看起来太晕了，解谜也有比较需要仔细思考的地方，有两三个需要小巧思的谜题，是稍微有挑战性的解谜游戏呢~

5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2021
Got it on sale, and I feel that those 13 euros and 3 hours spend were well worth it. If you like puzzle games and love stories, you should check this one out!

---

It's a puzzle game with a cool core mechanic I haven't seen being used to this extent before. Sure, some of the puzzles felt a bit too hard, and could have used some sort of hint. But every puzzle could be solved with a mechanic you already learned. Therefore it brought a huge satisfaction to me when I managed to figure them out. The trick beeing to think outside the box (pun intended).

Story wise, I found this game beautiful! Great voice acting with a story that made me feel for the characters. Never have a puzzle game have made me cry before, but this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game did.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
