Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2021
Ein kurzes empfehlenswertes Rätselspiel, was man aber erst in 2-3 Monaten kaufen sollte.

Das Spielprinzip wird im Trailer eigentlich ganz gut verdeutlicht. Man hat eine Miniaturdarstellung der Welt in der man sich bewegt. Und ausserhalb dieser Welt gibt es eine Riesenwelt. Jeder Gegenstand existiert nur einmal in allen drei Ebenen. Das heisst wenn man einen Würfel aus der normalen Welt in die Miniaturwelt legt wird der normaler Würfel durch einen riesigen Würfel ersetzt..... Soweit noch mitgekommen? :-D

Die späteren Kapitel weichen dann etwas ab und schicken einen auch durch kurze Lineare Level. Die Rätsel sind allesamt sehr simpel und schnell zu lösen. Leider hat das Spiel noch sehr viele Bugs. Ich musste mehre Male die Kapitel neu starten weil sich irgendwas nicht öffnete oder ich in ein Gebiet geraten bin wo ich nicht mehr weg konnte. Ich habe dann sehr lange nach einem alternativen Weg gesucht und musste mir schließlich ein youtube Video ansehen und habe dort dann gesehen das ein Ereignis bei mir einfach nicht ausgelöst wurde. Das ist sehr ärgerlich. Deswegen meine Empfehlung:

Wer kurze Rätselspiele mag sollte in 2-3 Monaten zugreifen wenn die Bugs (hoffentlich) beseitigt wurden
 
Redröm Neires

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2021
should not have a "Puzzle"-Tag, and most of the other ones.

Mainly a Story-Walking-Simulator with "Riddles" on the level of a child putting wooden-blocks in fitting holes.
Nothing more to the puzzles in 90% of the cases.

And once they found a cool idea for a puzzle they do it once or twice and then abandon the mechanic alltogether.


Also, the "recursive paradox" thing is not explored extensively, imo. Sounds interesting and fun, but is just not used enough.

Also encountered a few moments where we locked ourselfe and had to load an old save.

Sometimes you have to walk through small gaps which are "kinda obvious", and then there are moments where the game is just a bit glithy when "zoomed in" (small), and thus making you think you might have to get through there, just to get softlocked in a building you are not supposed to be in.


All in all a 2/5.

story war okayish, 3/5
puzzles sucked, 1/5
overall idea was nice.. 4/5

... but seemed more like a developer wanting to tell a story and having a random idea for a cool mechanic which just does not fit to the story. Should have been a "story-less" game which is just exploring the paradox idea of recursion and usage of objects to solve problems

you can't tell Romeo&Juliet in a Sudoku-Game

Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
Wow- I really enjoyed this game! I don't think I've written a review for a game before but for this I will. Right up there with The Witness for me as far as art and style, though of course the puzzle mechanism is completely different. Really enjoyed the puzzles. Not too hard, not too easy, and the solutions used the mechanics in a way that was really cool and imaginative. My only criticism is that I wish it was about 100 times longer; this is a world I would love to spend days or weeks exploring. And the soundtrack!!! Great music! I don't think I've ever actually turned up my speakers because of how good the music in a game is before, but in this I did multiple times.

Highly recommend - 5/5 stars, two thumbs up, gold trophy. Way to go Graceful Decay!
 
pOmEgRaNaTe
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
Maquette


Graceful Decay nous plonge dans l’inception de la maquette, un petit puzzle game a histoire.


- Maquette va nous faire vivre une petite aventure à travers Michael l’un des deux protagonistes du jeu, le deuxième personnage est tout simplement Kenzie sa petite amie. Graceful va essayer de nous raconter leurs rencontre et relation avec des méthodes très simpliste du style écriture qui apparaît et quelques dialogues avec des dessins, un système très minimaliste. Quasiment aucune histoire racontée via l'environnement comme a pu faire d'autres titres du genre on peut prendre l’exemple de The Witness. Ils ne posent pas vraiment de problématique ou ils ne vont pas jusqu’au bout.

- Bon on va parler du plus intéressant le gameplay de Maquette. C’est probablement le jeu avec la mécanique la plus chiante a expliquer a des gens donc on va faire simple ou essayer du moins.
Michael est dans un monde ou il y a la maquette de ce monde on peut interagir avec le monde qui interagit avec la maquette et pareil si on interagit avec la maquette ça influe sur le monde. L’inception de la maquette pour faire simple.
Mais c’est une mécanique qui pourrait être intéressante sauf qu’elle pose beaucoup de problèmes pour les dev. Je m’explique si on donnait au joueurs beaucoup d’action ou objet pour résoudre les puzzles… ça donnerait aux joueurs pleins de solution pour casser les puzzles ce qui est déjà le cas actuellement avec le peu de puzzles proposés et action proposer. Ils ne vont pas au bout de leur mécanique ce qui limite la diversité des puzzles et la difficulté faible du jeu.
Il y a quelques problèmes dans le jeu, déplacement des objets très rigide ça en devient insupportable à certains moment ( clavier souris pour ma part ), le manque d’un sprint pour certains aller retour, quelques collision un peu foireuse.

- A l’allure graphique a la The Witness mais qui ne possède malheureusement pas son charme, manque de fantaisie dans ces décors même si certains plans sont plutôt réussis, c’est beaucoup trop classique et peu innovant mais ça marche.
The Witness a fait l’impasse sur une BO alors que Maquette a une BO qui n’est que du chant pas de musique d’ambiance rien du tout ce qui manque de logique pour l'univers du jeu, The Witness c’était logique qu’il n’y est pas de musique île déserte( je simplifie The Witness ahah) alors que la on est dans l’imagination de Michael ou il nous raconte son histoire d’amour avec Kenzie ou on visite des lieux de vie des personnages, donc pourquoi ne pas avoir faire une vraie BO ? ( choix artistique je suppose ou économique )

Conclusion pour un premier jeu de Graceful Studio ce n’est pas mauvais ça fonctionne mais ça manque d’ambition et ils se sont bloqués avec leurs mécanique. L'histoire n’est pas incroyable mais ne gâche pas le plaisir de se balader dans les maquettes. Malgré ces défauts j’ai passé un moment agréable qui m’a durer 4 heures il n'en fallait pas plus.
 
KoHoh

l_6_l
315 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
5.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2021
I was cautiously excited about this game.

Ultimately, it tried to present itself as something that would push the boundaries of this nesting-doll world design - something which has been done well in other proof-of-concept projects.

What I ended up paying over 20 CAD for is really just a simplification of those ideas; immensely limited, and employed only to solve mildly frustrating puzzles which unlock incredibly unpleasant, unskippable narrative scenes.

All of this I forgive; it's reasonably fun to play, albeit quite overpriced and complete with some fairly serious bugs and oversights.

It's smaller details that really put me off. Untextured polygons are visible in many places, which for a game of such limited scope and design complexity is quite disappointing. It was trivial for me to break the apparent boundaries of the game world and fall off the map, while proving that the Maquette itself was not nearly as interesting or expansive as it tried to seem; that's fine, there have to be limits, but they did such a bad job of hiding it that I broke my immersion effortlessly. This whole thing feels like it was rushed out the door, where just a bit of extra care could have covered up the shortcomings of this product.

It's fine, but I would not pay more than 10 CAD for the experience. I feel like I bought a demo, and it didn't even have the usual "early access" assurance which keeps me away from projects like this.

Sorry Annapurna, you folks usually make good calls.
 
Sigmund de la Froid

Zenithian4
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mai 2023
이거 할 바에는 슈퍼니미럴하러 가라. 굳이 하고 싶으면 저장을 꼭 해라.

모든 면에서 슈퍼니미럴 하위호환이다. 퍼즐도, 아트도, 서사도 어느것도 슈퍼니미럴보다 나은게 없다.

기본적으로 퍼즐게임인데 퍼즐이 엉망이다. 단순한데 직관적이지 않다.

이게 무슨 말이냐 하면, 이 게임의 퍼즐은 그냥 글씨 쓰여져 있는 곳에 답이 있다. 뭔가 막힌다? 엉뚱한데 가지 말고 그냥 글씨 쓰여져 있는 곳이 아무거나 비비다 보면 답을 알게 된다. 진짜 개 단순하다. 그런데 그 문제를 해결하기 위해 알아야 하는 규칙들에 대해서는 어떤 설명도 없다. 뭘 어떻게 해야하는지 막막하게 되는 부분이 많다. 예를 들어서 크리스탈. 게임에서 크리스탈을 어떻게 써야 하는지 아무런 힌트도 없어서 그거 들고 30분동안 던지고 놀다가 우연히 부딪쳐서 나갔다. 지능이 필요한게 아니라 답을 찾아낼 때 까지 계속 시도할 끈기가 필요하다. 이게 무슨 퍼즐이야? 그냥 노가다지.

The witness도 아무런 설명 없이 스스로 깨우쳐야 하는 퍼즐로 악명높지만, 적어도 연습문제를 많이 줘서 스스로 깨우치게 해준다. 그리고 기본적으로 동그라미에서 시작해서 점으로 끝난다는 대전제가 항상 깔려있다. 중간에 어떤 규칙이 들어가든, 동그라미에서 점으로 이동한다는건 절대적이다. 슈퍼니미럴은 "이걸 어떻게 하라고?" 싶은 포인트가 거의 없다. 왜냐하면 문제를 풀기 위해 알아야 하는 내용들은 이미 초반에 다 익히기 때문에 그걸 응용하기만 하면 된다. 알고 있는 내용을 활용하기만 하면 되니 직관적이다.

그리고 위 게임들(The witness, 슈퍼니미럴)은 시행착오가 괴롭지 않다. 조작이 매우 단순하고 쉽기 때문이다. 이 게임? 진짜 팔다리 하나씩 자르고 하는 느낌이다. 움직이는 것 자체가 괴롭다. 그냥 가만히 있고 싶을 정도로 괴롭다. 들고 있는 물건 내려놓으려고 하면 딕 딕 딕 딕 좆 좆 좆 하면서 안내려지다가 다른 곳에서 내리기 누르고 옮기면 내려진다. 이게 무슨 병신같은 짓이야? 진짜 욕 안하려고 했는데 쓰다보니까 빡쳐서 참을수가 없네. 시발 QA도 똑바로 안해서 한번 조지면 재시도가 불가능한 포인트가 있다. 중간에 저장 안했으면 무조건 챕터 전체를 처음부터 플레이해야된다. 어디냐면 챕터4다. 챕터 4에서 계단 놓고 스케일 줄인 상태로 창살 사이로 들어가는 순간 게임 끝이다. 다시 시작해야된다. 시발 그렇게 들어가면 안되는거였으면 다른 부분처럼 막아놓던가 바로 옆 부분에서 창살 사이로 들어갈 수 있다는 규칙을 알려줘놓고선 그 다음부분에서 창살 사이로 들어가면 좆되는건 도대체 뭐냐? 규칙을 만들자마자 부정하면 도대체 뭘 기준으로 삼고 게임을 해야되는데?

아트? 슈퍼니미럴 하고 나서 이거 보면 별거 없음.

서사? 걍 사랑싸움임. 별 내용 없음. 서사에 올인했으면 그거라도 잘 만들어야지 왜 이런 이야기에 이런 퍼즐이 등장해야하는지 알 수가 없다. 그냥 이야기랑 퍼즐이랑 떼놔도 그냥 말이 된다. 그럴거면 왜 같이 붙여놔? 그냥 미연시나 하나 뚝딱 하고 만들지? 요즘 미연시 게임 얼마나 많이 나오는데 왜 굳이 퍼즐? 왜? 왜? 왜? 왜? 왜? 왜? 왜? 왜?

킹 합 적 에 는 이 유 가 있 다.

나처럼 돈 날리지 말고 다른게임 해라. 두번 세번 해라.
 
Sugaraddict
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
I'm having a hard time with enjoying this game, especially knowing that it could take players anywhere between 2-4 hours on a $20 base price. I'm sorry that I'd have to mention that up front, but there are a few more reasons why this game kinda left me disappointed:

- The narrative (in a sort of predictable fashion to me) is about how a romantic relationship begins optimistically, but then slowly starts to deteriorate. I don't feel like critiquing the contents of the narrative itself too much, but I didn't feel engaged with it. Maybe the narrative is only meant for people who've had a messy romantic relationship before.

- The gameplay can be tricky and convoluted (mostly cuz you're left to figure things out for yourself) but it also doesn't seem to mesh well with the narrative for me. How is a game in a paradoxical universe supposed to make sense with a love story? Either there's no connection that justifies it, or I just don't get it.

- There's no advanced graphics settings, which is an absolute shame. Fortunately, there are essential options like fullscreen toggle and an FOV slider, but not advanced settings to adjust individual graphic effects. So I guess my only options are to fiddle with the Low, Medium, and High graphics settings and I'll still get fluctuating framerates no matter what I choose?

Other than that, the game looks amazing! I do appreciate the visuals, environment art, and the music, but I guess it all didn't leave me feeling amazed by the end of the game.

If you really want to try Maquette, I'd get it on sale. If you're on the fence about buying this game, then take the reviews into consideration first.
 
CaptDedEyes
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2022
It was a fun puzzle game. Honestly, it was a bit shorter than I would have liked, with it only taking 5 and a half hours, but I don't mind that too much. I'll definitely play it at least one more time. (I'm writing this after my first play though.) There was only one place where I got so stumped I ended up trying something that I knew wouldn't work and got softlocked. (Come on, like you never tried to break a puzzle game at least once) Other than that, the puzzles were simple enough, but still enjoyable to solve.

I'm usually more into strategy games, but this was a nice change of pace.

You know that thing where a game has a cool mechanic that is only used, like, twice? Maquette is nothing like that. The way you can make objects change size by interacting with a mini model of the room you're in is a great mechanic that is heavily explored and utilized throughout the entire game. Each new puzzle is a different use of this mechanic, but it never seems to get old.

I'd say the game was worth it, although I did get it for 50% off during the summer sale.

Also, you've seen the trailers: The art style rocks.
 
Kbuild8
103 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 avril 2021
I enjoyed the game, but I do wish there was a neutral review option on Steam.

The puzzles were interesting, but I was left wanting more of them. By the time I felt like I got the hang of it, there was a ton of story exposition. Then a few puzzles later, the game ended. What's here is good, but if there was just a bit more packed in there, it would have been phenomenal.

Lots of other reviews I've seen have complained about the story. Yes, the story is predictable and "same-y", but I still thought it was done well. The voice acting was well done, the art was pretty, and there were moments that still hit the way they should, even if you expected them. Not to mention, this is ultimately a puzzle game. I care more about the content of the puzzles than story at the end of the day.

Overall, pretty good, but not amazing. Get it on sale and it's worth a good few hours. Just don't expect this to be something more than it is.

Recommandé
9.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 juillet 2023
For the most part, your standard puzzler/walking simulator type game. The visuals are quite nice, and the puzzles are creative. The different mechanics used in these puzzles are woven cleverly into the story. The game didn't benefit much from having a story, but it doesn't really detract from the experience. The main downside with the game, however, is that some of the puzzles can be frustrating because the controls are a bit clunky. Other than that, it's pretty solid. Some puzzles even had me scratching my head quite a bit. Overall, I would recommend this game. Achievements are fun too.
 
sjd9910
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2021
TL;DR: Its fun, but short and doesnt reach its full potential.

Maquette is a fairly fun puzzle game, if not quite as fleshed out as I would hope. I got around 4 hours of playtime out of it, taking my sweet time. Many of the puzzles are quite interesting and engaging, but it simply isnt long enough. Interesting ideas aren't explored as well as they should be. The story is rather generic.

The atmosphere and aesthetic of the game is beautiful. The puzzle mechanics are clever. You will probably enjoy this game, but end up wishing it was around three to four times longer than it actually is. I feel the emphasis on the story ended up compromising the gameplay too much. Still, if you like puzzle games you will probably get some enjoyment out of this.
 
ridleyfire
215 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2023
I really enjoyed Maquette. Like the trailers show, this is a puzzle game where you place objects around a dollhouse-sized area, then you can explore that dollhouse area as the size of the doll. So you drop a small bridge down over a gap, then you can walk across it yourself.

I was able to get through all the puzzles fairly easily, although I can understand why other people might struggle with them. You've got so much room to move about in, and the important details of the puzzles aren't always easy to see. I think I've just played so many puzzles games like this that I was able to intuit most of the answers right away.

The story about a break-up was also very good. It's very easy for a story like this to feel overwrought, but I think the writers struck a good balance with it. Overall, this was a fun game.
 
KinSpark

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2023
The basic principle is pretty cool and has some nice twists for the brain. Unfortunately it involves a lot of walking which is mitigated a little bit by automatically walking faster when walking for a longer time but it still feels really long at times. There is also one point where I was convinced I couldn't do a jump because usually jumps feel pretty short, but it was totally no problem. At a different point I was convinced I needed to jump further because what I was trying to reach was still far away, but it turned out I was totally already able to reach.
All in all I liked the puzzles because there rarely is too much clutter of objects to interact with.

Defender of Lorien
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
A short, story-laden perspective-based puzzle game in 7 chapters and the course of one beautiful, tragic relationship.

Pros:
* Beautiful, apt music at many of the major starting points.
* Levels are gorgeous.
* Puzzles are of varying difficulty - usually tough only if you haven't twigged to a new mechanic.
* Great voice-acting.
* Story is heart-breakingly relatable (how even wonderful relationships aren't guaranteed without lots of hard work.)

♥♥♥♥:
* Took me.. what, 4 hrs?
* About half the achievements are for speed-running the levels - hard pass, thanks.

Meh:
* No hand-holding - use the Options to find the controls, but even then it's guesswork.

TL;DR: If you like puzzles and love a good story, 7/10 (9/10, if on a decent sale); else, avoid.
 
tran_fors
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 mars 2021
Предупреждаю, что на момент написания обзора, наиграл меньше часа и пока не уверен, хочу ли продолжать.

Из положительного в этой игре я вижу только красивую графику (которую увы из-за слабого компа не могу оценить в полной мере) и интересную концепцию ключевой механики.
А из отрицательного, увы, все остальное.
1. Сопливый сюжет об отношениях двух художников. Лучше бы вообще была бессюжетная головоломка. История во-первых скучна, а во-вторых к происходящему на экране имеет мало отношения.
2. Кривое управление. Единственное что в игре есть кроме ходьбы - это взаимодействие с предметами и два важных действия "вернуть в руки" и "положить на землю" повешены на кнопки мыши. Уверен не только я путаю их между собой большую часть времени. Особенно обидно когда потратил время на точное позиционирование куда положить предмет, а вместо того чтобы положить, вернул в руки, что сбрасывает всё с трудом настроенное.
3. Ключевая механика с макетом выглядит классно со стороны, но неудобная в использовании. Я постоянно путал в какой последовательности класть и подымать предмет в макете и в реальном мире, чтобы получить задуманное.
 
YarikTH

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2022
Maquette - another proof that unworthy game cannot win BAFTA award.

▓▓▓░░ Visual (graphic & style) - cell-shaded colorful style, cute & simple.
▓▓▓▓░ Sound (music & environment) - sweet ambient sounds, dialogues sound real.
▓▓▓▓░ Scenario - just a heartbreaking storytelling...
░░░░░ Content - only main story here (prepared walkthrough).
▓▓▓▓▓ Innovations - how story has been told... how puzzles have been designed... It's just awesome.
▓▓▓▓░ Time taken - 3-4 hours for a full walkthrough, enough to fully enjoy & don't become tired.

▓▓▓▓░ (4.0) Maquette

Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2022
Плюсы:

- Неплохая идея с макетом игрового мира внутри игрового мира и манипуляциями с размерами объектов на которых строится core-геймплей в решении пазлов (хотя что-то подобное уже было в Superliminal)
- Клевый OST, который хочется переслушать еще раз отдельно и добавить некоторые песенки в избранное
- Голливудские актеры озвучивания главных закадровых персонажей: Брайс Даллас Ховард (Мир Юрского Периода, Черное зеркало) и Сет Гейбл (Код Да Винчи, Миллиарды). Актерская игра действительно получилась классной.

Минусы:

- Сюжет довольно скучный (история встречи, любви и расставания двух молодых людей) и никак тебя, в конечном счете, не трогает, а людям пережившим травматический опыт расставания скорее всего вообще будет противопоказан
- Игра визуально выглядит очень бедно, местами даже халтурно, а все из-за уклона в low-poly стиль. Хотя здесь и пытались максимально выкрутиться за счет арт-дирекшна и каких-то эффектов, этот момент можно еще улучшить.
- Целая куча багов: от летающих объектов над террейном и глюков с управлением до багов, которые блокируют прохождение и генерируют вылеты игры. Непонятно куда смотрели 10 человек из QA в титрах и сама Annapurna. Из-за этого игра ощущается сырой и недоделанной.
- Местами совершенно идиотские и нелогичные решения пазлов, на которых можно застрять надолго и придется в итоге лезть на YouTube (пазл с подбором размера ключа ближе к концу игры как идеальный пример плохо геймдизайна). Играть уставшим вечером не рекомендую.

Итог: это игра, как будто созданная специально для подписчиков PS Plus и Xbox Game Pass, чтобы каталог доступных игр выглядел больше. Отдельно деньги (даже по скидке) тратить на неё не советую. Очень слабая с точки зрения истории и пазл-геймплея. 2.0 / 5.0
 
Slashko
339 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
A game with a pretty interesting mechanic and very pretty artstyle but its hard to recommend.

For its current price I personally can't recommend it even though i did enjoy the puzzle aspect of this game.
If you enjoy puzzle games and the artstyle then i would say it is worth picking up on sale. Otherwise i would look elsewhere.

The gameplay can be clunky at times due to objects getting stuck and occasionally phasing through the level causing the need for loading from autosave, usually a little while back.
The puzzles are actually quite good and do make you think, its just a shame there wasn't more of them.

The story itself is underwhelming, the relationship goes on as you would expect and isn't particularly engaging, Get together happy, Things aren't going as well as hoped, Breaking up and then Moving on with your life. This all goes on in the background with text during gameplay sections and voiced cutscenes between scenes.
I was expecting it to amount to more, affecting the game world itself more and actually tie into the internal world and shrinking/enlarging objects.
The final 2 puzzle areas were a nice touch in this regard by playing more into the characters motivations but I felt like there wasn't the same climax when it came to the game systems we learned to use up to that point. These final chapters are also both over before you know it.

Which is probably one of the bigger drawbacks about this game overall, its length.
A lot of the gametime in the first half of the game is spent backtracking and for a game as short as this it is really noticeable.
My playtime is probably longer than some due to leaving the game on while seeing to other tasks or having to replay sections but you are likely to get 2-3 hours playtime.
 
Zero 1343
711 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
Locked in a church, with no way out, I contemplated again why I kept playing this game. I had made my way there in a way other than the creators intended and I was stuck. Now, you might argue that it's not the creators' fault that I got myself stuck in their game and you would be wrong. But let's assume you're right - what do I do next? My first impulse was to just stop playing - it's not that I was really enjoying the game anyway. But the story had just taken an interesting twist - and I wanted to see how it would pan out. So I reluctantly got myself to load the last auto-save and continue.

That was no good, the last auto-save happened after I got inside the church, so I was still stuck. My only other option was to restart the level, and go through all the trivial puzzles and tedious walking (a portal gun or translocator would have been handy) to reach the point before entering the church again. And that's not the only time I found myself where I wasn't supposed to be. The next level is a maze and, trying to find my way out, I got outside the map not once, but twice, by different means, my newly acquired ability to walk through rocks being a telltale sign that it's time to load a save game, manual this time (I've learned my lesson!) Speaking about manually managing save games, I'd like to mention an issue I had with the settings UI: I've been playing first-person games for two or three decades but this was the first time I couldn't set the mouse sensitivity to the level I'm used to - an instance of Apple-grade oversimplification.

So, why did I even start playing the game? I excitedly grabbed it immediately after watching the trailer, which showcases a recursive world, kind of like a fractal, where when you change something in one level of the recursion it also automatically changes in all levels - a mind-blowing idea really, just imagine the possibilities! But, if the developers had a creativity quota, it seems they spent it entirely on that idea. The rest of the puzzles (except maybe one) are trivial and uninspired, they are fillers really to what is essentially more of a cinematic experience rather than a game - so that you do something different every once in a while other than walking along, reading the writings on walls, and watching cut scenes. As Bilbo Baggins might put it, puzzles are so scarce that they feel like a small amount of Nutella scraped over too much bread.

As a cinematic experience, it's a nice one. Given the main concept of the game one might expect the story to be mathematically or philosophically inspired but it is instead the chronicle of a romantic relationship, a bold and welcome choice! Although simple, it is engaging, with good voice acting and interesting dialogue. The story is presented through cut scenes and excerpts written on walls, which have some literary value, although a few spelling mistakes detract from that somewhat. Also adding to the experience is the impressive architecture and the breathtaking effects of the world changing around you as you progress through it.

It is a shame that puzzle design didn't get the same attention - this is supposed to be a game after all, not a movie. I dream that one day the people behind the puzzles of a game such as The Witness are made aware of the Maquette concept and use it to create another puzzle game - to show the world how it should really be done.
 
foivos
0

Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2021
J'ai acheté ce jeu à la sortie en pensant y trouver un digne successeur de Superliminal dont j'avais trouvé l'histoire mauvaise mais le gameplay excellent.
Les deux premières heures m'ont beaucoup plu : le gameplay était intéressant et les dialogues touchants. Cependant, j'ai rapidement déchanté.
A partir de la moitié du jeu environ, certaines solutions de puzzle sont au mieux étonnantes, au pire totalement tirées par les cheveux. J'ai passé un temps incroyable à me balader d'un bout à l'autre de la map pour trouver la solution sans y parvenir. Au bout de deux trois occurrences similaires, je suis passé d'une légère frustration à un agacement total, comme si plus le jeu avançait, plus les puzzles étaient baclés.
Je regrette vivement cet achat.

Évaluation publiée le 2 mars 2021
Bit too short imo, but otherwise it was very nice and sweet. I did encounter a few annoying bugs in the beginning of the game, however it is the release day upon writing this, so you probably wont encounter them during your play through. I'm pretty sure I used an unintended solution for at least two puzzles.

The rest of this review is a spoiler to the story.


The story did through me for a loop. At the very end of the game it ends by saying goodbye sunflower. It was also revealed that all of the text you've been reading were apart of a letter meant to help the writer move on. However, and maybe this is just me, I was under the impression that the person writing the letter was the guy, for the entire story. That might just be because I imprinted myself onto the protagonist. However nonetheless I feel like some of the context of the story was lost on me because of this confusion, which sucks. Either that or missed a part where he refers to her as sunflower, but I am pretty sure she was the only person to use that nickname

4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
This game was not worth the price or my time for how difficult this game was. The rest of the reviews are very similar. Maquette was obviously not playtested at all and needs to be worked on in order to improve the gameplay. There is no way a person would be able to figure out most of these puzzles unless instructed with a walkthrough. I severely hope that the developers improve this or create a restart level where the player can reset if they lose an important object, because the only reset resets the whole game. Also, not being able to skip cinematics is merciless as well if you have to reset the entire game. Normally, I can tell if I didn't understand a puzzle where they would've shown me that I missed, but there were no in game clues to be able to teach a player what to do at all. Impossible game and the graphics/voice acting can't make up for the bad gameplay.

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
评价：可以购买，但没必要。
游戏性：本作通过大小场景之间的互动来实现解密是本作最大的卖点，而且也确实相当有趣。但是本作的谜题数量太少，很多部分仅仅是浅尝辄止，并没有完全发挥出这一套系统更深入的玩法，而且不知道是我走了邪道还是谜题设计本身如此，有部分关卡的解密方式非常奇怪，个人认为做的不是很好。有部分关卡为了剧情牺牲了解密。体量偏少，在我有部分关卡卡关的情况下也就用了不到5小时便通关游戏。
剧情：上面提到有部分关卡为了剧情牺牲解密内容，本作的剧情虽可以说“不错”，但是远达不到“精彩”。个人认为这方面的平衡做的并不是很好。
画面：本作剧情全部通过速写的方式来呈现，画面体验很不错，是加分项。
音乐音效：本作每关的开头都会有人声歌唱的BGM，但是唱完之后就完全没有BGM了，只有游戏音效，这让我感觉比较奇怪。有部分关卡的音效听着非常的让人难受，这本不是一个恐怖游戏但是却会有让人毛骨悚然的感觉，差评。

总体而言，本作虽然玩法新颖，但是无论是从游戏体量再到游戏细节都有或多或少的毛病，并不推荐购买游玩

Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
Lamentablemente el juego no está bueno. Quiere hacer muchas cosas a la vez y ninguna le sale bien. Como juego de puzzles es bastante simple; como juego de plataformas los controles son PÉSIMOS, y la física es desastrosa, llena de bugs; y como walking simulator la historia es bastante floja, ♥♥♥ algunos puntos interesantes pero poco interesante. No recomiendo que lo compren. Quizás en alguna actualización mejora la cantidad de bugs y los controles un poco, y solo en ese caso puede valer la pena comprarlo muy rebajado. Por lo que vale este juego compren Outer Wilds, Firewatch y The Witness, juegazos que hacen bien todo lo que este juego intentó e hizo mal.

Recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2021
「Maquette」中文评测——迭代空间亦难掩叙事平庸
作者：Probe | 你也可以在 probe.earth[probe.earth] 阅读这篇评测文章

非欧空间与解谜游戏一直都能产生让人眼前一亮的化学反应。Valve 开发的传送门系列，用一把传送枪让玩家初尝了于三维空间中自由传送的舒爽体验；而由 William Chry 开发的解谜游戏 Manifold Garden 则将非欧空间的概念发挥到了极致，最终呈现出的则是一款集视觉与空间感上的双重盛筵。

Maquette 整个游戏的创意出发点很简单——每个人的童年都有玩玩具搭积木的体验，但如果你在改变玩具世界的同时也在改变你周围的世界，会产生什么样的空间谜题呢？

迭代生成的无尽空间

Maquette 是一个法语词，原意是模型、原型。而在游戏中，Maquette 则代表了玩家刚进入游戏就能够看到的这个巨大的红色圆形穹顶建筑。

整个游戏的地图和谜题完全以 Maquette 为中心展开：华丽艳目的红色穹顶的正中央，摆放着另一个红色穹顶的“缩小模型”，模型的四周则被同等比例下的模型建筑所环绕，这就构成了整个游戏的内部。而当玩家走出穹顶就会发现，原先的缩小建筑变成了正常比例，并且还可以在其中自由探索，这就是游戏的外部世界！没错，Maquette 与我们平常所理解的三维空间并不相同，它是一个“迭代”的空间。任何对于模型空间的改变：比如丢个木箱或者扔把钥匙，都会即时地反映到你身后的真实空间中。这种不同比例下世界的迭代与交织，构成了 Maquette 的第一个视觉冲击点，同时还让人不禁想到了艺术家埃舍尔所创作的众多空间错觉作品。

随着探索的逐渐深入，玩家会逐渐发现这个世界的其他机制：例如，通过调整模型世界中的元素，你不仅可以涉足之前从未有可能到达的领域，还可以改变游戏中道具的大小。当你在模型地图上掷下一个骰子时，另一个（或者是同一个）巨大化的骰子也同时在你的背后滚动。这一系列在三维空间中绝无可能做到的事情却能够在 Maquette 的世界中轻易实现，游戏的谜题设计也就此展开。

不过，在玩家熟悉了游戏的基本机制之后，Maquette 的解谜却没有在机制探索上更进一步。这样一个创意十足的迭代世界本身谜题设计的潜力巨大，但是开发者却没有像见证者或者 Manifold Garden 那样充分地探索该机制下各种谜题的可能性。仅停留在表面上的创意型谜题限制了 Maquette 的整体深度，不免让人感到些许失望。

用最美的画面讲述最平庸的故事

和很多其他解谜游戏一样，Maquette 也想尝试将解密玩法与游戏叙事结合起来，但是最终的叙事表现却让 Probe 感到失望。游戏通过配音与世界中的文字，讲述了两个偶然相遇的年轻人从初识到互相萌生爱意、再到恋情火热、但最后却热情退散、各奔东西的故事。不论从剧本本身还是从和游戏结合的演出效果来看，这段故事都是平庸且毫无新意的。初玩游戏十分钟，从两人邂逅的剧情开始，玩家就已经能大致猜测到未来的剧本走向。这样普通的故事线完全无法给游戏本身优秀的画面效果增色，反而拖沓了整个游戏的节奏。具体来说，在流程进入后期，男主依然沉浸在失去恋情的痛苦中时，开发者想要通过世界的崩坏来表现男主绝望的感受。但此时的游戏解谜却与叙事完全割裂开来，两者毫无关系，玩家自然也很难与此时的主角产生共情。

所以，整体说来，Maquette 的游戏叙事是平庸的，虽然看的出来开发者尝试想要将叙事与玩法相结合，但这样的结合在游戏内是机械且无代入感的，这也因此让游戏的游玩节奏大打折扣。

总体评价

Maquette 是一款以空间迭代为基础的解谜游戏。它有着精美的视觉艺术呈现以及数首优秀的游戏配乐插曲，但是却在谜题深度以及叙事乏善可陈。

7/10

P.S. 如果你喜欢 Probe 写的游戏评测的话欢迎关注我的 Twitter 和 Twitch 直播[www.twitch.tv] 来支持 Probe！
 
Probe
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
你搁这搁这搁这呢
禁止套娃
这种套娃的设计思路我以前有思考过，要想设计好非常复杂，本作就给出了一份非常精妙的设计，谜题不带重复，机关非常精巧。并且本作的套娃不是简单的套娃，而是在套娃之间建立关联，把这套机制运用地非常棒。
不过也存在一些问题，在缩小后，游戏节奏倏地一下就降低了，会比较难受，尤其解谜方法试错了的话这来回跑几趟就想砸键盘了
还有个非常大的问题是显然解谜引导是有问题的，很多暗示，不经过提醒完全想不到，但是一旦理解了这个暗示，就会觉得很精妙，设计者没有很好地把握住玩家的思路，引导玩家的行为
另外我个从不晕3D的玩这游戏竟然都有点反应
个人不太喜欢这个剧情，但是也许能戳到很多人的点
果然独立游戏是游戏业界创新的试验田www

Non recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2021
I really wish I could recommend this game, but not at full price in its current state. I think the graphics are beautiful and the recursive mechanics are very fun, but not when recursion causes the game to crash when unity can't handle 4+ occurrences of the universe simultaneously (a tall order to be fair). The artistic talent of everyone involved in this little indie game is notable, but I didn't feel like there was enough *game* in my game. 1/3 of my play time was spent backtracking because the game decided to glitch out or crash my computer. $4/hour of gameplay isn't worth it, especially with such little replay value.

Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2022
Reviewed on:12/26/22

Quick thoughts: This game is a cute game with a story that I wish we saw more of. Unfortunately It is still very buggy with even some crashing or soft lock bugs encounterd by many. Further puzzle difficulty varies VERY widely beyond what I found enjoyable. Ultimetly if its DEEEP sale pick it up (maybe around 3-5 bucks) or if you are really hankering for a romantic story in your puzzle game, otherwise it might be best to leave this one alone.

Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2022
TL;DR: Buy this game if you want a few hours of stylish puzzles that you'll never play again.

The game is pretty. The puzzles are fun and challenging. The music is good. However, the narrative feels contrived and out of place. The "story" doesn't have any relation to the puzzles, and only a vague relation to the world's aesthetic and mood. The constant cut-scenes are distracting and feel like they exist only to pad the game out. In addition, I don't think there's much replay value. I feel like I'd easily remember the "trick" to solving all the challenging parts.
 
Hazel

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mai 2023
The game wasn't horrible, but not worth $20 either. A fair price for this game would be around $2-$3. The story wasn't super engaging, and rarely even related to the gameplay; the story and game are just sort of shoved together. Also, the gameplay itself is good at first, but gets old after a bit. The game is a bit buggy and even crashed a couple of times, and the gameplay only lasts a couple hours, so paying $20 for this is like paying $10 per hour of gameplay. My advice would be to not buy this game unless it's on sale for at least 90% off.

Non recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 juin 2021
This game is the exact definition of a walking simulator, it has a lot of slow walking.
The story is same old cliched girl with a heartbreak and telling her story on which a lot
of webisodes and games are being based off of, too linear, predictable and boring.
And ugh the puzzles, for me personally puzzles were frustrating, I don't know exactly why, but it didn't have that satisfaction
after solving them like Talos Principle had. The game is neither good at story telling nor at puzzles.
And, yea did I mention this game crashes a lot too, and the lags too.
On the flip side, I do think it has some amazing voice actors.
I had a lot of hopes for an Annapurna Interactive published game.
 
sonicnick154
53 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2021
This isn't a bad game, just an overpriced one. I beat the entire thing in under 5 hours (including all achievements), and I wasn't rushing (except to earn the speedrun achievements, but I only went for those after doing a normal playthrough). And this includes the multiple points where I deliberately went out of my way to go places which (I knew beforehand) were dead ends, just to see what was there. You can buy all three "The Room" games for the price of this one game, and each individual "The Room" game has more content than this one.

Also, I got softlocked a few times. Be wary of that. And the game frontloads its difficult puzzles in the first two chapters (not including the prologue), in addition to some of the answers not being intuitive (a certain "jump on rock to escape" solution comes to mind, since it's hard to get ON said rock in the first place, so I thought it must not be a solution). And there aren't all that many ACTUAL puzzles to solve, in the end. So it's not the best of puzzle games in that regard. "Better than passable" would say it best, with a decent story and visuals (though not the BEST visuals on closer examination, and since you often have to make yourself tiny compared to the world around you, you will be closely examining many parts of the world whether you want to or not).

If I'm being generous to the story elements and atmosphere, I'd say the price of this game should be around $10. As a pure puzzle game, however, it should be priced $5 or less. And I imagine that's what most people will buy it for. Regardless, $20 is too high from a consumer standpoint. Perhaps it needs to be that high to make up for the money spent in production, from the developer's point of view. People who were going to buy it anyway can probably afford $20. But I imagine better recursion games will come out in the future, for cheaper, and when that happens, the price of this game is going to need to go down if you want anyone to buy it.

To your average puzzle game player, I'd recommend waiting until this game goes on sale before buying.

dragontweaky
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
Comment dire... "The Maquette" pourrait s'apparenter à un brouillon honnête de la série "The Room"... sauf qu'il est sorti 10 ans plus tard.

Il parvient à peine à la cheville de ses prédécesseurs, quelle que soit la caractéristique sur laquelle on s'attarde : moins profond, moins long, moins riche, moins complexe, moins beau... tout en étant deux à trois fois plus cher !
L'histoire (une love story guimauve) ne m'a pas franchement emballé : j'aurais préféré + de puzzles (j'en ai compté à peine une petite dizaine au total - je ne tiens pas compte des faux puzzles qui consistent à errer dans un "labyrinthe" à sens unique).

Des soucis de game design, dès le chapitre 2 :
- des énigmes répétées strictement à l'identique (simplement avec des objets légèrement différents)... en manque d'inspiration si tôt les gars ? ça n'augure rien de bon pour la suite...
- la même clé qui sert à ouvrir 2 serrures... qui n'ont pas du tout la même forme (vous êtes sérieux !?)
- quand on teste toutes les possibilités et qu'on aime expérimenter (ce qui est un peu l'essence même des puzzle-games), il est possible de "perdre" certaines pièces définitivement (obligé de reprendre une sauvegarde)
- aucun système d'indices (trop compliqué à implémenter sans doute ?)

...et en particulier s'agissant de la "réalité large-scale", qui est ni faite ni à faire :
- les déplacements dans cette réalité sont lents à en mourir, et 95% du temps après avoir marché pendant plusieurs minutes on se rend compte que la destination que l'on visait est inaccessible car la marche de l'escalier est trop haute... et il faut refaire tout le trajet à l'envers
- j'ai passé 30 minutes à explorer cette fichue réalité dès le chapitre 2, alors que cela n'avait strictement aucune utilité à ce stade du jeu... mais dans ce cas pourquoi y donner accès si tôt ? surtout que tout le reste du jeu est hyper linéaire, on est coincé dans un "couloir narratif" tout au long de la partie... du coup le seul moment où on peut s'en échapper c'est pour découvrir... que c'est totalement vain.
- je me suis retrouvé coincé dans cette réalité large-scale au chapitre 4, dans le jardin aux 3 maisons, sans aucun moyen de revenir en arrière (et allez, encore obligé de reprendre une sauvegarde).

Pour ne rien gâcher, dans cette "réalité large -scale" les graphismes et textures sont simplement étirés, et le jeu qui n'est déjà pas très beau (à part certains effets de lumière sympathiques), devient moche à vomir.

Pour continuer : des contrôles pétés
- clic DROIT pour DEPOSER un objet !? non mais dans quelle dimension tordue vous vivez ?? le nombre de fois où un objet que j'avais soigneusement positionné s'est réinitialisé à cause de ça...
- le saut :
> pendant tout le jeu on est limité à des sauts de puce, on ne peut rien escalader à part des obstacles de la taille d'un dé à coudre, on est coincé devant un tas de sable, et tout à coup en plein milieu du jeu on est censé deviner que l'on va pouvoir miraculeusement sauter par-dessus une barrière ?!?
> on ne peut pas sauter d'une chaise vers la table située 10 cm + haut... en revanche on peut (toujours en restant sur ladite chaise), actionner le levier situé à 50 cm au-dessus de cette table !!! (seriously ?!)

Cerise sur le gâteau : les bugs
- Des dialogues qui ne se déclenchent pas au bon moment (j'ai eu à plusieurs reprises 2 fois le même dialogue à 2 endroits différents du jeu... et parfois des bouts de phrase qui n'avaient aucun lien avec la précédente occurrence)
- Un bug majeur au dernier chapitre, qui empêche de terminer le jeu : après avoir zoné 3/4 d'h pour essayer de comprendre à quoi servait un levier, j'ai découvert sur des soluces en ligne qu'il était censé activer un timer... qui ne s'est jamais déclenché chez moi, quel que soit le nombre de fois où j'actionnais le levier. Obligé à nouveau de recommencer le chapitre (avec en prime un spoil sur l'énigme).

Bref, ne vous laissez pas avoir : à moins d'une méga promo, "Maquette" ne mérite pas son prix. Et il ne suffira sans doute pas à apaiser votre soif de puzzles.
Vous les connaissez sans doute déjà, mais tous les jeux ci-dessous remplissent tellement mieux leur contrat (et à des tarifs beaucoup plus abordables) :
- The Room (en particulier l'épisode 3, qui offre 4 à 6 heures de gameplay pour seulement 6€)
- The Eyes of Ara, + long et + riche, avec des énigmes + variées
- Superliminal (pour le même prix)
- The Talos principle (beaucoup plus cher certes, mais pour une expérience dingue et 30 à 50 heures de jeu)
- Gravitas : un portal-like très court mais gratuit

6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
Un beau jeu basé sur les dimensions avec des couleurs vives et gaies, un son d'ambiance plutôt effrayant puisqu'inexistant mais des chansons inclues ça et là au fur et à mesure de l'aventure très agréables et une histoire poétique sans trop de texte à lire. Les énigmes ne sont pas très dures, il a fallu quand même me creuser la tête pendant un bon moment avant de trouver la solution de certaines. Somme toute génial ! Terminé en 5h, plus qu'à le speedrunner pour obtenir tous les succès.

Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2022
I picked this up because I was in the mood for a puzzle game and the mechanics here looked interesting. And they are, but holy hell this is a great game. It's just beautiful, the soundtrack is fantastic, the voice acting is amazing, and the story is so very moving.

I took my time with it and finished it in about 4 and half hours. Loved every second of that. The puzzles were just challenging enough, everything felt like it was paced perfectly. This game is highly recommended, and I will be buying the next thing from Graceful Decay the second it comes out.

Puzzles were interesting, but sort of disconnected from the storyline. Only one or two of the puzzles made me pause. The real value in this game is the unexpected love story. It's not a Hallmark Moment, but made me reflect on myself and my own relationships, which is more than I bargained for in a walking sim/puzzler.
 
Loki
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2021
DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review

Maquette is a game developed by Graceful Decay and published by Annapurna Interactive

The game offers some nice graphics and a really beautiful aesthetic, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

The game does suffer with some repetitiveness at certain areas of the game but a fun game nonetheless

Maquette overall, however, is a fun game to play, yet sometimes repetitive and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is a good adventure puzzle game to play in short bursts!

RECOMMENDED :)

REVIEW SOURCES:
  • None
 
ThePCGamer
1,934 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2022
パズルの進行度に合わせて2人の男女の恋物語が展開していくわけですが、そのシナリオがクソ過ぎる。
初めの方は微笑ましくて良いんですが、半ば辺りからソリが合わなくなって喧嘩ばかりになってギスギスで気分が悪いです。男の方は遂に耐えかねて何もかも投げ出して逃げます。観ている側としては最終的に大団円ハッピーエンドの為の前フリ何だよな？と思って進めるんですが、最後はキッパリけじめつけて別れてスッキリしたお終いチャンチャン。
なので「なんやこれ一体…」となる事必至です。
そのシナリオがパズルに密接に関わっているかといえばそんな事もなく話が無くても全く問題無いレベルです。
開発の自己満足やオナ○ニーを無理矢理押し付けられてる感じで最悪の気分でした。

肝心のパズルの方も正直出来はあまり良くないです、解いた時にすっきりしたり、満足感や達成感、納得感などを感じることは少なかったです。
他にも、進行の導線が分かり辛かったり、オブジェクトの上に登ったらスタックしたり、本来有るはずの進行のためのスイッチが出現せずに手詰まりしたり、持ったオブジェクトが置きづらかったりなどなど、細かい不満点が結構ありました。

唯一グラフックはメルヘンチックで綺麗かなぁと褒めることの出来る点かと思います、そこ以外正直お勧め出来るポイントは無いです。
総じて一級品になれなかった格落ち作品といった印象です。
 
f ogw
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 janvier 2022
As much as I love these kinds of melancholy experiences (i.e. Gone Home, Firewatch, What Remains of Edith Finch, etc) This game just barely misses the mark in my opinion. First of all, the game doesn't even have a nice frame rate. Steam tells me it's a high 140+ FPS, but in truth it looks around 30 FPS. Anyway, that aside, there are a few puzzles in here that simply are just not intuitive and it had me stuck for no good reason. Also, while sometimes the puzzles could be fun and intuitive... I simply do not get what they have to do with the story. Cool idea, but the background story would've been much better fitting as something else (even though I actually really liked the story). As a number rating, to me, this game gets a 5/10. I hate to do this, but overall this is a not recommend for me.

Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2023
Good use of recursive puzzle mechanics. Reminds me of the puzzles of Portal and Superliminal.

Story is stereotypical falling out relationship, however the ending gave it a more positive change (rather than a "Let's get back together" aka it takes two or "forever broken" negative ending)

It is a bit short (as of this review I have 100% the game) but it is good nonetheless.

4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
Lange auf das Spiel gewartet. Und es hat sich auf jeden Fall gelohnt. Kann es jeden Freund von Puzzle Adventure mit einen neuen Blickwinkel empfehlen. /

Nachdem ich es durchgespielt habe. Super Spielerfahrung. Wer aber ein langes Story Game sucht ist hier falsch. Mit neuen Konzepten und Frischen Game Design finde ich die länge äußert angenehm. Es zieht keine Mechaniken unnötig in die Länge. Und wer mein es wäre viel Backtracking der hat sich wohl zu lange im Kreis gedreht. Knackig frisch und Farbenfroh. Von mir auf jeden Fall einen Daumen Hoch.

Spielzeit zwischen 3-5 Stunden

Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
IDK guys, not every game should be hardcoooor puzzzzllll reeeee. Let us casuals have some fun.You're very lucky that you have powerful brain which allows you to use it and solve these things in a second, ours is not - yes I got stuck here multiple times trying to figure out how the sizes work!
This game is a bit longer, has mechanics which resemble Superliminal, but still it's different.
The storyline reminds of Florence - but male version of things. For me it was interesting. And yes, such is life. I am currently struggling with same feels so it got to me.
I'd rate it 7\10, more than average.
PS. The OST songs are just WOW, especially the ending.

Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2021
Produit remboursé

Beautiful game, interesting mechanic. I was absolutely into it before I bought it. Mostly because I left the trailer on mute.

The story is a cliche and frankly I didn't care about or like anyone involved. That it didn't have much to do with the game didn't help. The soundtrack fit the story, which is not a positive here.

Basically, nice game, pretty game, bad decisions turned it from a fun diversion to a refund.
 
Robocephalic
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 mai 2021
Maquette is a 4 hour experience which for 16 bux isn't the worst deal. It tries something a little different. It's interesting, but also terribly optimised, it just gets framy for no reason all the time.
There are a lot of moments where you're not sure if what you did did something or if a certain area lost its importance or if you still have to do something there.
It's not like a Test Chamber game that restricts access to areas you don't need anymore, which makes it feel very artsy/untidy.

There's a lot of walking in this game, it does feel like a walking simulator with some gameplay thrown in most of the time.
I like the recursion mechanic tho, I just wish they did more interesting things with it.

There's a moment when you can pick up the Maquette from inside the Maquette. I managed to insta crash my game with that twice. Do not recommend xD
 
Broockle
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juin 2023
In short: Play Superliminal instead.
Want a game with similar mechanics but with much more advanced and mind bending puzzles, a lower price, and no ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ story that you can't influence and that's forced down your throat? Get Superliminal.

This "game" tells the story of a break-up. It doesn't give you anything else. The game mechanic looks "cool" at first. But don't let looks device you: There are no clever puzzles. Just an irritating story.

In the end, the game tells you that "Some weirdo from Annapurna didn't need to send a letter to their EX, because writing it was enough for them to get closure" ... but Annapurna needed to make a game out of it?! W-T-F?!?!

Break-ups are painful, and the way to a break-up is ugly. The game forces you to witness it all. In other words, the further you progress, the more ugly the story gets. And the F-ing "game" DOES NOT GIVE YOU A CHOICE! You are just a witness to some guys trauma. The awful narration by your typical *generic male and female voice* didn't help either.

Life is difficult and F-ed up enough. Why would you want to have someone else's SH*T forced on you? The answer is: You don't. You don't want to touch this game. At all.
The "game" doesn't teach you anything you don't already know or haven't experienced yourself. It doesn't give you any advice or make you ponder.

It is a pretentious piece of SH*T.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2023
Produit remboursé

Being a huge first person puzzle game, I ignored the reviews and tried.

The story really is a major weak point, and the puzzles really do feel under developed.

As someone who wants to make their own indie first person puzzler with a story, someday I consider this game educational. Though I still had to return it, if it ever goes on sale for $2~3 I'll pick it up again and finish it, but not before then since that's what I feel the game is worth, or if it comes up in a bundle. It really feels like a bundle game. Not good enough to stand up on its own, but enough to add some value to a bundle.

It's at the very most a $5 game and I can't recommend it above that price. But if you can ever get it for <=$5 Than I'd recommend it.
 
Argo
1,343 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2021
Very middle of the road game, peaks at end, is worst in the middle. Not in terms of the story though that's a tired plot the whole way through, but the game does stay consistently pretty even if graphics options are super limited. With the price it's at right now I can't really recommend anyone to buy the game with how average the game is overall.
Like gameplay starts fine, becomes really bad, then becomes good. Story is bad throughout, but overall presentation is great. I dunno, maybe at like 10$. If you have a choice between this and Superliminal, play that over this, even if I don't agree with it being rated overwhelmingly positive. However Beginner's Guide on the other hand, (this game feeling like a combo of the two games) is definitely worth getting if you're okay with walking simulators.
I guess I should also mention that like, yeah $20 for 3-4 hours is too much, I mean yeah its an overdone point to make but I gotta draw the line somewhere especially when the games as middle of the road as this is, bleh.

594 produits enregistrés

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
Room mate and I played this game back to back on nearly identical PC's. On a level towards the end, she was able to progress where i could not. Im essentially softlocked and my save is ruined.

I have to press a switch and its supposed to open a door a far distance away on a timer. The problem is, the timer door does not open and the timer doesnt start. So i just press the switch and nothing happens.

Im having to have my best friend send me her game so i can continue from the same point.

Fix this please. I can give more information if needed...

EDIT: I was able to beat the game. I restarted the map, got the exact same softlock, restarted again, and i got a different softlock where i couldnt click the owl.

I took the building and finagled it to where part of the stairs were clipping through the door on the opposite end. I was able to get to the book and click it, which allowed me to continue the game and beat it.

Being 1 puzzle away from the end and it softlocks you is the most aggravating thing in the world.

Also, I think people hate the story because its sad and no good ending. I honestly loved the story, but im a sucker for love stories.

I still wouldnt recommend this game due to the fact it was...

1. Epic store exclusive for a while

2. Buggy as all hell

3. Can be beaten in 35 mins if you know what you're doing

4. You might have to utilize a glitch to beat the game since the game softlocks constantly.


If yall fixed this game... it would be amazing.

The atmosphere was cool I guess but the boredom killed me.

VeeArr
537 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 décembre 2023
O jogo possui uma história interessante, é uma abordagem sobre o processo de se apaixonar até o momento de seu término. Gosto principalmente do trabalho dos atores que fazem as vozes do casal, muito talentosos. A trilha sonora também é deliciosa.

Mas não recomendo porquê como puzzle esse jogo sofre em oferecer uma gama de desafios que sejam interessantes a partir de sua mecânica base de perspectiva. Em alguns momentos a sensação é que você tem que adivinhar o que deve ser feito, porquê o jogo não lhe ensina o que PODE ser feito, lhe deixando encurralado.

Outro GRANDE problema é a queda de FPS constante mesmo com os gráficos no Baixo, chegou a CRASHAR no último capítulo.

Apenas como um jogo completativo seria mais apelativo e poderia ter melhor desenvolvido a história. E sem essa história atrelada, talvez pudesse ser um melhor jogo de puzzle.
 
serjo
65 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2023
All'inizio sono rimasto un pò stupito per le recensioni miste perchè per me Maquette è stato un gran bel racconto.. Poi mi sono ricordato di qualche incespico nel gameplay e qualche ruvidità che in effetti mi hanno fatto fermare più di una volta e hanno quindi reso l'esperienza meno fluida di quanto avrei voluto. Se riuscite a superare qualche pecca nei puzzles (almeno dal punto di vista dell'esecuzione di alcune meccaniche perchè emotivamente e visivamente sono magnifici) per me rimane uno dei migliori titoli Annapurna insieme a The Artful Escape. Entrambi mi hanno commosso e fatto stare bene e a entrambi sono particolarmente affezionato. Consiglio di iniziarlo a scatola chiusa, senza calarsi troppo nelle anticipazioni dei trailers..avrete una storia non convenzionale, raccontata in modo bizzarro e davvero autentico.
 
Gattonemaomao
146 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
19.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 novembre 2023
More of an art piece than puzzle game. I'd say about 70% art 30% puzzle. Absolutely baffling visual, audio, and story. I felt like there could have been more concepts explored but I'm happy with what I got. Though there were a few times where I felt a little cheated because I either wasn't aware of all the puzzle elements or they had a misleading design to them, for example...(spoilers)

I never would have guessed I was supposed to use the key for a door that had a flat head screw type lock when all the other times it was keyhole shaped. Only sometimes the key would disappear after use.

There was also a puzzle where it made you believe you had to change the size of one key but really there was a seperate key all together. It was justified by the story but idk maybe could have been a more elegant way to clue you in.

CC
758 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 septembre 2023
Comme un goût d'inachevé en terminant ce jeu...
La mécanique de jeu est top mais pas suffisamment exploitée à mon sens, et ça se ressent dès le début du jeu.
Idem pour la direction artistique, assez standard une partie du jeu, quelques bonnes réalisations par moment, mais là encore, pas assez exploitées.
La narration quant à elle est... peu intéressante. Voir parfois HS. Elle casse même l'immersion par moment. Pourtant, là encore des idées qui auraient pu être mieux étirées (comme les scènes devenant plus dark avec l'évolution de l'émotion du narrateur).
En bref : la sensation d'avoir joué à un jeu plein de potentiel qui aurait été terminé à la va-vite.
Je recommande tout de même pour la découverte, et je dis bravo aux devs pour le gameplay original.
 
loga-rythme
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 mai 2023
まず第一の感想として、パズルゲームとしてとても良く出来ている。
一見「あれ、これ詰んでね？」と思える状況でも、よーく周囲を見ればちゃんと解き方が用意されている。
例えば、崩れた道を渡るために橋の模型を使うのだが、また次の崩れた道を渡りたいときにその橋の模型が建物に飲み込まれてしまって取り出せない！？とか、途切れた道を繋ぐためのスイッチが、渡った先の地面にあって届かない！？とか。
個人的に良く出来てると感じたのは、色付き宝石を綴じられた空間から遣り繰りするところ。あれは気付ける人ならすぐ気付くギミックだし、私のように察しの悪い人間には気付けたときのカタルシスが強く大きい。ただオブジェクトを振り回していたら偶然解けてしまって「えっ！？」みたいなことにもなりそうだな、とは思った。
パズルゲームとしては「困った時のヒント機能がない」という点が、人によっては難易度の高さに繋がる要素と考えられる。
一応、進む必要がないエリアには光の壁ができて「今進むべき道」を示してはいるので、何処に行けばいいのか分からないということにはならないと思われる。
動かせるオブジェクトの動作には物理演算が掛かっているせいか、動いている状態のオブジェクトにぶつかりに行ったりするとスタックするし、オブジェクトは結構遠くの方に置くことができてそれがプレイヤーには進行できないエリアに入ってしまって詰むことは起きうる。オートセーブが導入されているが詰んだ状態でセーブされることもあり、「チェックポイントからロードする」とか「すべて元の配置に戻す」みたいな機能はないのがちょいと残念。
操作できるオブジェクトは光を放つものの、小さくし過ぎたオブジェクトは割と見失いがちなので、無意味に小さくするのは止めましょう。
 
reiya
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2023
bir aşk hikayesinin çok boyutlu yansımaları...
 
jactantia

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 aout 2023
Um jogo muito bonito com uma trilha sonora muito boa. A história começa muito bem e tu começa a se interessar pelos personagens, mas logo na metade o conflito é apresentado de forma muito súbita e tu não consegue se importar com a briga entre eles. Isso faz o final ser bem vazio e não merecido pelo jogador. As mecânicas são interessantes mas não são bem aproveitadas nos puzzles. Alguns puzzles tem soluções saídas de lugar nenhum onde não há deduções, apenas a busca pelo item correto no lugar correto. Pra quem quer ver essa mecânica melhor explorada eu recomendo Patrick's Parabox.

Пазлы в основном завязаны на игру с перспективой и размерами объектов (но не как в суперлиминал), а содержание повествует в очердной раз про то как у молодых людей начинается отношач и сначала всё хорошо а потом похуже. В этом смысле на ум приходит Florence, но чот меня никак не отпускает мысль что я видел что-то ещё более похожее.

A beautiful / Interesting puzzle game that's actually doable but not intuitive at times and that's fine. Has an underlying story they must have wanted to tell, doesn't really have anything to do with the gameplay.

Final few chapters / puzzles didn't really fit with the game and felt rushed, like they wanted it to be over but not ditch work they'd already done. Would have been nice for it to have ended before I started hating the game and wishing it was over.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 avril 2023
Looks very pretty.

Constantly takes control away from you to show you, ever... so... slowly..., some object appearing or disappearing, ever.... so.... slowly...., whilst some story about a couple's life is revealed in a pretentious*/whimsical* patchwork (*depending on your taste for such narrative).

There's a game of different scales between the 5-minute slow motion pans and fades, I'm afraid I did not have the patience to discover it. The first hub level was trivial compared to similar games, maybe it gets harder, but I was getting nauseous from the forced camera motion and the dialogue, so I took it no further.

Controls are janky - objects you place get stuck easily, locking up controls. Odd control scheme doesn't help.

Wanted to like it. Didn't.

such a disappointment. game is beautiful, but damn is the narrative painful. this is the problem with games with 'emotional narrative' and 'allegorical level design', you are not actually participating in the dialogues, narrative and everything, there is no risk in fumbling and losing the chances for romance or whatever, its so not engaging.

should have focused on the actual beautiful level design and created a narrative that actually participated in it. even the witness was more engaging than this. wasted potential, refund due to poor narrative implementation and awful dialogues

Évaluation publiée le 20 février 2023
Easily one of my favorite narrative puzzle games of all time. Myst, Return of the Obra Dinn, Unavowed, this is right there with them.

The puzzles are not necessarily easy - but they are fantastic, and I fell in love with the characters immediately.

I have anxiety, is there anything I should worry about? Nope! Except it's a tear-jerker, be careful of that. ;)
 
eWords
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
23.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 février 2023
I can see how this game isn't for everyone, but I enjoyed the heck out of it. Puzzles were just the right amount of challenging and mind-bending. I never experienced any of the show-stopping bugs that some users reported (maybe they've all been fixed in later updates?). Some of the puzzles were hard to get the piece in the correct spot, but I got the hang of it.

The story was... fine. But completely unnecessary. As far as I can tell, the story that unfolded during the game had absolutely nothing to do with the gameplay... like zero correlation. It was sort of like the game was already made and someone was like "this needs a story." And it was slapped on just to have a story. The voice acting was good though.

Bottom line, if you like first-person puzzles with a physics-bending element, give this a try! If you get into the story, great. If not, you can skip all the cut scenes.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2023
Very cool concept of bending reality by interacting with the maquette itself. Overall, I feel the learning curve could have been a bit better, partly making some more use of skills gained earlier. As it is, there's quite a few puzzle solutions that can be tough to figure out but that don't have a good enough payoff. Though there is the potential for soft-locks if you're not careful, given how complex the main mechanic is, a modicum of common sense will prevent those.

At the same time as the puzzle, there's a love story going on. In my opinion, it is well-written and well-acted and got me emotionally invested. Personally, I would have loved to see a different resolution to the story, but that's just down to personal preference.
 
Kippesoep
296 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2022
The art design and puzzles are fantastic. Get the game for those alone but then switch the audio off. Play some music you like instead.

The "story" is laughable. It feels like it harks back to a San Francisco that existed in the 1970s where the lifestyle was bohemian and carefree. While, according to the story, the two characters Michael and Kenzie could very well have painted together while sipping wine in the park back in the 1970s, the fact that they live in the 2000s (they send texts with their phones) makes the aforementioned scene a complete anachronism.

And maybe Michael and Kenzie's relationship is a problem only to people over the age of 40 for whom a modern relationship where the man is neutered and the woman sounds like a mewling teenager is cringe-inducing. If you're 22 and this couple describes the kind of relationship that you find healthy and balanced then you'll enjoy this story.

Finally, the couple breaks up for the most stereotypical of bust-ups: "you never *listen* to me". Wow. That was deep.

Beautiful though, and worth the playthrough.

Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2022
One of the most (If not THE most) unique puzzle games I've ever played. My main complaint is that I wish it was longer. I'd have loved to see this concept taken even further, with more levels.

My OTHER complaint is that the story is just a series of voice-overs that you hear whilst playing. Obviously, the gameplay is the thing you're paying for here.

Highly recommended if you're on the hunt for a mind-bending 3D experience.
 
Rusty
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2022
This game is so good I can almost recommend it. There are definitely good points, but in the end I had to force myself to finish.

I like the art style and general concept (shades of the much better Superliminal). I also liked the puzzles, in principle, which are medium-level - enough to make you pause and think, but not too obscure or frustrating.

What is frustrating are the bugs, movement and controls, which are pretty clunky. And the story's a bit pants, despite pretty good voice acting.
 
Richie Radix
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 octobre 2022
Great game, I had a ton of fun playing. Highly recommended.

However, I was very frustrated trying to bind controls at the beginning. Rebinding is very difficult and rebinding the mouse was impossible. Every time I restarted the game it would temporarily forget my bindings until I went to rebind them again and it would suddenly remember. I almost didn't play the game because of this frustration, and I recommend anyone who is particular about keybindings beware. This game came out a year and a half ago and these issues still aren't fixed.

Non recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 septembre 2022
Ok so I really like this game and was looking forward for it releasing. I played 5hrs of it, got towards the end I think but then stopped playing for a year or so. I've come back and my save is gone for some reason, but oh well, I remember liking it so I booted up a fresh save,
this is where it begins to fall apart, the game is very jittery? I have a fairly decent PC and yet it just doesnt run smoothly no matter what I do.
I really like the environment and puzzles in this but when the smoothness of the gameplay starts failing, I cant chill out and play this game, it just gives me a headache

If you are willing to put up with it, defo get this as I remember loving this game (well there were bugs but I didn't mind working around those). puzzles are great, perspective based akin to superliminal and the art style is sweet
 
ShankABat
202 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 septembre 2022
It's complicated!

First things first: I really liked this game. The puzzels were balanced quite well and made the best of the mostly repetitive mechanics. This game is a lot about perception and size manipulation, but it used this in a quite smart way. That way it didn't feel like you were doing the exact same thing over and over again.

The story that encompanies the puzzles was really nice and enjoyable, although very clichee. Admittedly, it was not very original, but it connected to me on an emotional layer and the two voice actors did a perfect job. It mostly sounded like I was actually listening to real conversations of real people and not actors.

Also it's a quite short game with about 3 hours, which I personally liked.

Now on to the bad stuff
The framerate seems to be capped at 60fps. There's no setting to change that. And while I can imagine where this comes from (rendering multiple layers of the same environment with objects interacting with it), I still think that my graphics card could have done better than 60fps. At least give us some way to disable frame limits. You can still put up a huge warning or so, but please let me change the frame rate.

Even worse than the framerate issue: The controls... This game is a lot about placing objects. I got so annoyed at times that I thought about quitting the game. Sometimes you're stuck while carrying an object around. Then you need to drop the object, reposition yourself and pick up the object again.
Sometimes picking up an object and dropping it in the same location won't work, too.
Or the fact that you can't look straight up in the air. That annoyed me so much. The controls were really the biggest turn down.

Also there have been some game breaking bugs which had me reload the last checkpoint. For such a short game I actually don't expect any game breaking bugs.

I still recommend this game, because of the great puzzles and the voice acting, but as long as the issues with the controls and the game breaking bugs exist, I can't recommend it for the "full" price which is about 17€ for me at the time of writing. Maybe get it during sale.
 
[MGU]_Rickyy_

Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2022
I feel like this game needs a disclaimer.
This game is about the relationship of two people that started awesome but didn't go well. I didn't even work out in the end. This is a soul healing game. You get to see two people fall in love, then fight and then break up, and then, one of them gets over it .

Still, if you don't mind the spoiler above, I would recommend it mainly because the puzzles made sense. Almost all of them, anyway.
 
Aramil
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juillet 2022
Понравился визуал, игры с размерами игрока и окружения, взаимодействие с паззлами с помощью макета и общая рекурсия (макет внутри макета внутри макета внутри макета и т.д), хотя по сути находишься только в малой ее части. Но всё же ощущается некая пустота. Фоновая музыка отсутствует. Есть несколько песен, каждая из которых играет в свой определенный момент, да кое-где звуки пробиваются. Сюжет плоский, унылый и беззубый. Решаешь загадки, чтобы получить очередную порцию голосовых страданий от сладкой парочки влюбленных, у которых сперва всё сюси-пуси и розовые пони, а потом на ровном месте "ах, он меня не понимает!!111". Из-за этого с середины игры уже захотелось поскорей её закончить. Хотя она и так короткая, а задачи нетрудные (но можно застрять по невнимательности, как я умею). Короче говоря, как правильно кто-то выразился в комментариях: это лишь макет игры (хм, а вдруг разработчики это и имели ввиду?). А 475 рублей за макет - жирновато. Лучше в Итана Картера или Эдит Финч поиграть.
 
Orlyana
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 juin 2022
The game tries to be smart with the puzzles, but the level design is really not well done to give clues or help players focus on the next objective. And there are achievements fillers like those encouraging players to speed run the game again after finishing once... but as a puzzle game there's no point of redoing all the puzzles. The challenge of a puzzle game is in the first run when trying to figure things out, and that's about it. Once that magic is gone, replaying the game just trivial.
The music is great, and some puzzles are fun. The story is unsatisfying but somewhat realistic. While I don't dislike it, I failed to see how the story fits into the game. The script feels like retrofitted to make the game bigger/longer than it needs to be. Honestly it'd have been perfect as a shorter game going from stage one to the falling apart stage (the stage where you have to move a ladder many times and touch bell up top of church). Also as other mentioned, THE GAME CRASHES IN THE LAST LEVEL. I had to restart 3 times. and one of them I had to go into task manager and end the game manually because it stopped responding.
In short, the concept is cool, but the execution is subjective, which IMO, not great. The art and music are lovely, and that's about it.

0
Recommandé
12.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juin 2022
Solve puzzles to advance the story. I liked how you often needed to use the recursive nature of the game's world to solve the puzzles. Some of them were real head scratchers - although I'm a pretty slow gamer; it takes me a longer than average time to play through a game.

Two quibbles: the story itself isn't very compelling. It's not a story I would bother to read. It would have been nice to have a story with some stakes. But the gameplay was enjoyable enough that it kept me going through the end. Second quibble: please don't make me sit through the credits when I'm done. Thanks.

sotozka
163 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2022
Annapurna Interactive doesn't disappoint. Another gorgeous game, that, while short, is worth playing.

It is as much a walking simulator as it is a puzzle game. The core of the game are spatial puzzles that rely on a recursive world: anything changed in the maquette is reflected in the real world and vice versa. It's challenging enough to be engaging but not too difficult, and, most importantly, rather original.

The story itself is nothing extraordinary, it's just enough to give a foundation of everything else in the game. I expected some twist that would move it from "OK" to "good", but that twist didn't came, so at the end, the story is OK, but just OK.

What the game lacks in story it makes up with everything else. The visuals are really beautiful even with the game having a low-poly graphics. The voice acting is pretty good, and the music is nice too.
 
kangirigungi
150 produits enregistrés
0

0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 mai 2022
The game is too short and IMHO the mechanics are under explored. The story told during the gameplay has almost nothing to do with the game itself... and is not that great either.

But the "fractal" mechanics are just pure awesome.
If it's on sale, buy it.

SAVE
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2022
很不错的小品解谜游戏，嵌套的设计还有更多开拓空间，谜题有创意也有深意，跟背景剧情有所联系，特别是开启外圈的时候，感受到感情行进的阻力。
谜题的难度算是恰到好处，其中只碰到过两次卡关和一次感觉应该是用非常规的方法通过了，因为无关的区域会有墙挡着，眼下能用的东西还是比较直接不用特地去找。
画面很漂亮，这个美术设计是下足了功夫的，bgm也很好听，剧情略嫌平庸，不过换句话说很生活化，是你我都有可能碰到的情况。

Amazing. Next to the mind bending recursive concept and the absolutely gorgeous style, the story - though it felt cheesy in the beginning - grew on me fast and ended up giving me goosebumps after goosebumps and nearly crying - aided by the brilliant sound track. If you have a romantic streak, feel artsy and like puzzles this is the game for you.

O jogo é maravilhoso, gostei da historia porém umas mecânicas ficam enjoativa, em minha opinião a historia fica muito demorado também por conta dos puzzle,

OBS1: INFELIZMENTE, tive o problema de o jogo crashar no final ao clicar na estatua azul, sendo assim não conseguindo terminar a historia, o jogo, nem a conquista de conclusão. outras pessoas tiveram o mesmo problema e nunca obtiveram solução. é muito broxante não conseguir terminar o jogo por conta do crash...

ATT(13/02/23) : TERMINEI O JOGO CARAI, DEPOIS DE QUASE UM ANO, ERA O ONBORD QUE ZOAVA. Depois de pegar uma placa de video, eu consegui terminar. Agora eu to triste e depressivo. A historia sempre me pega de mais.

Enfim, a mecânica é enjoativa mas a historia é uma delicia de tristeza

Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 avril 2022
Definitely an interesting and different puzzle game. Although, I both liked and disliked this game because of the puzzles. Sometimes I thought they were very cleaver and sometimes I thought they were just a bit obtuse.

I also personally found the story engaging, but I imagine people's mileage may very. It felt like a very "real" story.

Overall, I would recommend the game if you really like puzzle games with a story; the recursive nature of the puzzles is quite an interesting twist.

不愧是Annapurna社，美术风格没得说，想象力还是一如既往得丰富。
和超阈限空间有异曲同工之妙，实在是太喜欢这样的解谜游戏了，
虽然游戏玩法与剧情关系不大，但是物体大小转换的解谜实在是太厉害了。
不得不说解谜难度确实有点大，但是解出来真的很有成就感。

很棒的美术风格，循环套娃解谜的设计是非常有创意的，有足够让人惊艳的地方，但在有些谜题设计的不够好，缺乏提示和指引，多次卡关，剧情和游戏结合得不够紧密，只有场景略有联系，但是场景和手绘是真的很好看！！！
总的来说，虽然不够惊艳，但仍然是一款优秀精美的游戏，打折入手，原价慎购。
