32.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 février 2022
I loved the concept of this game so much, and the points in the plot where things look grim match up with the atmosphere of the puzzles very well. The soundtrack is amazing and haunting at points, and the sound design is very thoughtful and fun. It was the first game I ever considered speedrunning, and the community for this game has been super welcoming. It's a gorgeous, buggy game with untapped potential, and I hope to see more from the creators.

Recommandé
7.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2022
Maquette é um jogo de puzzles bem simples que envolve perspectiva e sua principal mecanica é diminuir e aumentar o tamanho dos objetos (e seu proprio) para prosseguir as fases.

Não espere nada extremamente desafiador, é um jogo onde claramente o foco é a história sendo contada, mas, é um bom jogo para relaxar quando se tiver um tempo, em torno de 4h é possível completar o jogo.

Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2021
Кратко и понятно + и -:
Плюсы:
-саундтреки приятные и разно-жанровые
-гемплей удобный, помимо быстроты ходьбы (но к ней потом привыкаешь)
-история очень интересная и не стандартная в понимании конца любовных романов
-визуал 10/10
-разработчики edit finch
Плюсов еще можно понаписать, но это основные.
Из минусов:
-если вы не любите головоломки, в особенности усложненные, то мимо
-жалко птичку

¦BẄ¦ Bre!Tl!ng
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2021
It's not a bad game, I would have given a neutral rating if that were possible, but i cannot really recommend it.
It feels like the really great concept was not fully utilized and there would have been so much more potential for difficult puzzles. Most puzzles were too easy in my opinion.
The story was okay, however I didn't like the seemingly fast transition of a new love to feelings of aversion towards each other. But maybe I'm just too romantically minded :)
I liked the aesthetics and I think they suit the story and concept very well.
On the one hand I enjoyed playing the game and the developers did a good job, but it left some kind of a bitter aftertaste after i finished it, because of the aforementioned problems.

Recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 septembre 2021
This game is a yes by the THINNEST of margins. The whole thing was a bit janky, but overall I enjoyed the gameplay, that is until you get to the second half of the game where you leave the gazebo behind. In the controlled environment, the jank was fine, but once it got more free-form it became annoying. Combine that with the most frustrating puzzle controls I've ever used during the rotating puzzle boards (maybe it was just a controller issue since I don't use mouse and keyboard) and it did not make for a fun second half -- so much so I was about 5 minutes from quitting all together during this puzzle.

The story was very boring and not at all suited for the gameplay premise. The actors were fine, which made it not too bad though. I just never felt like the story had much of anything to do with the environments or anything happening on screen.

Lastly, the music stinks. The devs really want you to think they're cool.

So, all and all, play this knowing it won't be good, but it's not a "bad game".
 
40GallonTophat
866 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 septembre 2021
I'm so glad that Annapurna Interactive is producing indie games like this! It's refreshing to play something a bit different. I recommend this game, but with a warning that it has issues.

The puzzles seem to have just one solution, but some of them are not very intuitive. The rules seem to change, which makes it hard to intuit. I got false negative feedback that my solutions were incorrect on multiple occasions, which left me confused and without any other idea of what to do. When fumbling around looking for a solution, all I could do was walk back and forth retracing my steps. At first, I enjoyed being in the space, but about half way through I grew impatient. I got stuck in the level geometry once and had to restart. For me, these frustrations added up, and I wasn't enjoying myself at times.

I have mixed feelings about the story. It is about the arc of a romantic relationship. When compared to fiction in other media, this is a very basic story that has been told many times; however, games with this production value don't cover this subject matter often, so I found it refreshing, if ultimately forgettable. The voice acting, though, is great!

Overall, I enjoyed Maquette, though I had to push through some frustration. If you are looking for something a little different and will not be deterred by some rough edges, then give it a chance.
 
HowlerMonkey

33.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 septembre 2021
I looooved this game! The art was beautiful, the story engaging and haunting, and the puzzles were super fun. There were a couple instances where the "camera" panned at objects that I felt was unnecessary, like the gear for instance, and I did initially struggle with the crystals and what to do with them but other than that it was really good! Oh! I noticed there was a glitch in the room with the tetris-like puzzle, at one point as I was carrying one of the pieces, it glitched through the floor and I had to reload the game. But overall it was a wonderful experience and I absolutely recommend it.

画风精良，色彩绚丽
解密方式具有一定的自由性，以至于能看到特殊场景长按F返回的良心提示

Recommandé
6.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 juin 2021
Maquette is a well written story wrapped in a puzzle game. I found the puzzles to be engaging and the narrative well performed.

The game does suffer from some technical rough edges and would benefit from a bit of polish. I ran into a few situations where I knew the solution to a puzzle but couldn't get the game to do what I wanted it to do. I also found a couple repeatable ways to crash the game to the desktop.

Despite the technical issues, Maquette is fun and I appreciate the time I spent with it.

Évaluation publiée le 11 juin 2021
Maquette nos cuenta una historia de dos personas enamoradas, que se ven afectadas por sus acciones y sentimientos, lo que los lleva a replantearse el estado de la relacion. La buena calidad grafica y el diseño 3d del mundo nos lleva a disfrutar las escenas llenas de detalle. Respecto a los puzzles tiene una dificultad facil-media, pero algunos resultan poco intuitivos por lo que puede llegar a dar unos dolores de cabeza en ciertos momentos. Recomendado

Évaluation publiée le 23 mai 2021
홍보영상에서 보여주는 감성 그대로, 기대한 수준의 초현실적인 감각을 줌. 개인적으로 이런 감각을 바라고 구매한 것이기 때문에 매우 만족함.

장점:
볼륨이 충분히 큼 (2~3시간)
난이도 상승속도가 적절
트릭 설명이 친절
타임어택 도전과제도 있고 반복플레이하기도 괜찮음
모션 블러 있음

단점:
컷신 스킵이 없음
가든 쪽을 바라볼 때마다 조금씩 버벅거림
물건을 쥐고 놓을 때에 원하는 곳에 들어가지 않고 끼이는 경우가 많음
넓은 곳은 너무 넓어서 이동시간이 좀 걸림 (게임 구조상 어쩔 수 없지만, 어쩔 수 없이 답답함)

Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2021
Like most games that Annapurna publishes, Maquette is an enjoyable experience with a great soundtrack and unique twist on traditional gameplay. The voice acting and visual design are particularly fantastic, with the puzzles being fair yet challenging.

Technically, it does seem to run strangely on 144hz displays (jittering/low refresh rate during camera movement), but it's easy to get used to and will hopefully get patched/updated at some future point. I only had one performance/bug related problem on the final puzzle of the penultimate level, that made it very difficult to solve.

Overall, it's worth your time if you enjoy puzzle games like The Witness , Antichamber , and Superliminal .
 
bakkaman
734 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 avril 2021
No idea why the response is mixed. This game is great. The design is frankly stunning -- mind-bendy mechanics aside. It's like a crumbling post-earthquake San Francisco meets the World Showcase at Epcot. It's stylized yet incredibly detailed, fantastical yet grounded. I ended up walking very slowly throughout the whole thing to absorb everything I was looking at, taking nearly 1.5x as long as most players to finish. (Played it first on my partner's PS5 and then got it for PC so I could play it again.)

The story, sure, is predictable, but what story isn't? What makes this game's narrative special is it feels so honest. When the couple whose metaphorical memories you're traveling through argue, it really feels like you're in the room with a couple having it out. Very uncomfortable, very true to life. When they're getting along, you smile at the unforced chemistry and humor. You learn just enough to understand these people and are denied enough detail that you're left curious about what happens next. It's delightful.

Lots of others commented on the puzzles, so I won't go into that except to say it's just the right amount of challenging, balanced nicely between gameplay and the unraveling of the story. Set aside a couple hours and relax with this sweet, dreamlike short story of a game.
 
nervousdandy
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 avril 2021
I love the style, I love the voice actors, Love the soundtrack, I like the cliché relationship story.... But I don't like the clunky mechanics. When leaving specific objects behind, it can get behind a shielded area, unable to pick them up (if they are the wrong size). Also bugs where you're unable to drop items or cancel actions. Also certain logic behind the puzzles doesn't always feel intuitive. I've played similar puzzle games (Superliminal, Manifold Garden,...) but certain puzzles didn't feel "logical" at times to use "this" for "that". (or you're not eased into it, like in Portal) It's a shame really, lots of value in this game, but the mechanics feels sometimes broken. If they would fix certain mechanics, I would definitely rate this higher. So I give it a 6.5/10 for now. I will recommend this game, but i'm a bit torn.

ExclamationMarc
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mars 2021
This game is an interesting one. I love walking simulator puzzlers, and this game fits that bill perfectly. The main mechanic of increasing and decreasing the scale of things is a very creative and innovative one, leading to interesting puzzles I'd never seen before. I feel like the developers have explored this mechanic enough for it to be worth the price tag, although some puzzle bits are used a few times over. The puzzles vary from being okay, to really interesting and mind-boggling, to downright frustrating. The game isn't too difficult overall, but there were some moments that I had to think outside the box, which was great and felt good. However, some puzzles did require a solution that was unexpectedly out-of-the-box compared to the ones previous to them, which might give some players a bad experience.

I think the overall biggest problem with this game (bought at launch), is the obvious lack in technical polish. The environments look amazing (and are definitely the thing that makes me love this game), but there are big problems with the performance (even on a GTX-1080) and some interactions in the game that feel downright clunky. The biggest problem I've had with the game was the movement speed. Because you're either huge, normal-sized or tiny relative to your environment, the movement speed is way too high most of the time, and then way too slow the other times: it never hits that sweet-spot. Extremely frustrating when trying to enjoy the environments while flying through them at 100mph.. I wish they'd made the movement speed dynamic, and added a sprint-button for people that wanted to go faster.

All in all I'd recommend this game. I'm positive that they'll fix some of the technical issues, and the puzzles in the game are interesting enough that you should give it a try, but do expect to be confused or frustrated sometimes.
 
Virtual Turtle

Non recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2021
The premise of the puzzles was clever, but the actual implementation ended up falling flat. Too often puzzles ended up hinging more on things like finding where a hidden switch was or unintuitive environmental interactions rather than clever use of the recursion mechanic. Most usages of the mechanic devolved to "use a smaller layer to move an object that would be too large on a bigger layer. The actual interesting usages of the mechanic were few and, once used, never appeared again. The mechanic also didn't feel great to use as it drastically slowed down mouse movement and held objects frequently got caught up on things.

The storyline itself was interesting enough, but unfortunately let down by the surrounding game.
 
Brokenpipe
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mars 2021
It's a beautiful game with a lovely story that's brought down by just really awful puzzle design. Everything with the size mechanic the game hails as its selling point works just fine, but the game stumbles over itself in every other facet of its puzzles. I quit the game when I tried to jump over a wall to reach the next area and was greeted with an invisible barrier, only to then be stumped by the very next puzzle which requires you jump over the exact same type of wall just in a slightly different place. The story is great, the characters are lovely, it's got such great writing I wish I could love the gameplay...

Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2021
The game does have it's issues, a bit short, prone to soft locking, mechanics can be clunky at times, and I had a bug that required I restart the chapter to fix it.

However, the core game mechanic is really fun to mess around with and even more fun to solve puzzles with. The soundtrack is beautiful, the graphics are very pretty, and the story is simple yet touching. I 100% recommend it.

i hate to write this but, i'm really disappointed - i was very much looking forward to this game. i have loved everything annapurna has put out there so far. the visuals are really beautiful, but this game fell flat for me, not only because the mechanics lacked the proper developing and foundation, but also because i got soft locked into an area that was definitely an oversight on the developer's part, and due to the autosave feature i now have to start the game over from the beginning. i also wasn't a fan of the random music that would start blasting at the beginning of each chapter that always seemed out of place. wish there had been more ambient music.

Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2021
Absolutely drop dead gorgeous and mind-bendingly trippy puzzler

Think Superliminal but pretty as well as technically incredible. Highly satisfying mechanics.

Nice and short, clocked in at 4 hours.

The game absolutely will not guide you with hints, and requires a lot of lateral thinking so when you get stuck it can be frustrating. Finally getting the answer nearly always put a smile on my face though.

I did however break the game a few times, items becoming inaccessible and one crash, it's worth making some manual saves but also replaying a section once you know the answer is really quite short.

0
Non recommandé
1.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mars 2021
The graphics are nice, the story is neat and the characters are well done. But the puzzling is just not that entertaining. Well, it could be entertaining. If the game would give you the concepts its going to use. The maquette thing is still fairly easy to grasp, but the items you need to finish a puzzle are often unclear and some of the concepts you need to understand are just not introduced entirely. Like the gems to touch other gems to open the door, it really wasn't clear that was even an option. That you could put gems through certain parts to take out, wasn't clear and so on. The game has some nice concepts but even a tooltip would've helped to understand a few things about this game. It really needs a tutorial or something to guide you to its possibilities. On the whole it would be a nice puzzlegame if it showed its concepts that you need to work with. Now it just falls flat because you tend to just use a walkthrough because everything is so unclear. Unless the devs change this, I'm not going to recommend it.

I just had an issue where the game frozen, but not my pc. In "The Exchange" when I clicked on the blue owl. The first time it happened I waited for about a min but nothing was happening. I could hear the person move and jump, but nothing changed. I then restarted my pc and when I open the game, at the same part. The game froze and a little pop up box opened and some loading bar was moving. Then the game just closed. Idk if I am the only one who had this happen to.
 
vervada
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
7.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2021
I went into this game not knowing if it was a Puzzle game with a story elements, or a story game with puzzle elements, and unfortunately it is the latter in my eyes.

The game is very pretty, and the mechanics cool, but it lacks the puzzle depth I'm looking for in a game. Many of the puzzles are just 1-2 actions, and then wait for a cutscene.

I played it though 2 times, where i just tried to “speedrun” it the second time, and here the cracks really started to show, i would spend as much, or more time watching/listening to the cutscenes than i was playing the game.

The areas are pretty but there is nothing to do except doing the 1-2 actions and moving on.
I think I would have liked the game more if there were 10-15 puzzles in each area, this would also have made the story less dominating.

I cannot relate to the story in any way, but while showing the gameto my gf we thought it was neat that the player character could be either person of the story. But neither of us could relate to their problems.

Early in the game you can get an achievement for getting “out of bounds” but then in the later levels invisible walls have been erected because it's not the intended route.

The game is too short and simple for me to play it again for puzzle reasons, but i will most likely still show it off to friends for its design and atmosphere.

zhouruitong112
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2021
I want to say up front that I enjoyed Maquette. It's intriguing and very pretty... BUT...

Maquette describes itself as a recursive puzzle game but a more honest description would be that it is a narrative game with puzzle elements. The recursive stuff you see in the videos makes it seem like this is some brain bending physics playground but in actual fact the game is very guided. (If you are a fan of games like The Witness then you are not going to get that kind of experience here.) Story signposts pop up regularly to let you know exactly where you should be focusing. The number of things you have to play with is often very limited and the game doesn't reward going off the main path. If you want to play with the physics I strongly recommend saving regularly as it's easy to get stuck or place required objects in impossible to reach locations and end up losing a bunch of progress. As far as the recursive part goes, you will mostly be dealing with the small and normal sized world. The game makes it really obvious when it's time to travel to the larger world and it is usually a quick trip out and back. The different areas are very "one use" and are replaced or locked out once you've solved the puzzle therein. Also, some of the interactions can be quite problematic. I think there were two occasions where I progressed because of what felt like a glitch rather than actually solving the puzzle. There are also significant sections which don't take place in the recursive area at all. This isn't a bad thing. There are some interesting new mechanics shown off in those sections, but it does make you realise how much the marketing for this game has hyper-focused on just one aspect of the overall experience. As far as I'm concerned this is doing the game a huge disservice. I think a lot of puzzle fans will pick this up and be disappointed and narrative game fans might well be put off by the apparent puzzle focus. Fortunately I like both styles of game so I went in expecting one thing I enjoy and discovered a different thing I enjoy.

So yeah. I recommend this but know what you are getting. It's narrative game with very pretty graphics, good voice acting, and a decent enough story in a genre you don't often see in computer games and some cool puzzle moments.
 
Werehare

Overall, this game is alright. It's very similar to Firewatch.

The recursive mechanism is actually really interesting, but doesn't feel like it was fully fleshed out. The puzzles, at times, feel like they break their own rules and can be quite frustrating. Additionally, it's very easy to get yourself stuck.

Non recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 mars 2021
As a fan of Annapurna Interactive's story puzzle games this one was pretty rough. Short, not very hard puzzles, and not the most believable story. Not that games have to be long to justify their worth, but with every introduction of a new puzzle mechanic, they never really go anywhere. Not spoiling the story, but the two people involved are both garbage at their relationship, so you never feel any connection and is more an interruption to the gameplay to remind the player that they are both terrible humans.

I can't recommend this game, but I would say pick it up on sale because it does have some interesting puzzle mechanics that were fun to break the game with.

Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2021
This game has the potential to be an awesome puzzle platformer but like others have mentioned, the controls are buggy and frustrating to use sometimes which is a shame as its a core mechanic of the game. Also like others, wasn't a fan of all the walking that had to be done (needs a sprint option) but at least there's some good music to listen to along the way. I think though, if you're a fan of puzzle games in general, then you should still play this because it does make you think, the visuals are pretty nice and the music is good also. Id definitely be interested in a sequel if they ironed out the kinks in the current version!

Évaluation publiée le 7 mars 2021
Its a tenuous recommendation because I'm not entirely sure what this game is. The puzzle tech is quite fascinating and fun to play with, but its rarely utilised to its best with puzzles that it feels like you have to bodge to get to work or are sometimes outright just not telegraphed well at all.

In all its more of a story-driven walking sim (as much as I hate that term), your mileage may vary with the story just about a relationship. I guess I'm satisfied with the impressive puzzles in the conclusion, but I'm still not entirely sure what I just played.
 
Ed
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
This is a satisfying puzzle game that takes place in a beautiful, intricate and recursive world. The puzzles move from very easy to very difficult over the course of the game, but they always feel like pulling off a magic trick when you solve them. There may be times when you feel stuck, but all you need to complete the game is the ability to shift your perspective. Luckily the mechanics of the game are all about shifting the way you look at and interact with the world, by moving from one layer of the maquette to another, from tiny to giant, from details to big picture, and from flat to tilted. Really enjoyed falling into the magical logic of this world.
 
madelonia
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
Let's be honest, the game is very pretty and the story that goes with it is nice, also as someone who have never played recursive type games before, I found the puzzle mechanics are very well thought and playing with the scale of objects to progress through the game was lots of fun.
Nevertheless, this game seems not polished enough for me. As I was exploring left and right, it didn't feel like I was progressing through the story, but just solving puzzles for the sake of it as the only moments where you can hear some music is when the story is told, apart form that NO ambiant music, and to me it kinds of cuts you off the story and leaves you in an empty 3D world. Also there are still lots of bugs and glitches that needs to bo fixed (I couldn't finish the game because of a door that wouldn't open even after restarting).
Even if I enjoyed playing the game, I'd not recommand buying it right now, but rather wait for a sale and some fixes.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mars 2021
A very good walking sim by my standards => It is an interestingly well crafted world to explore with modern graphics, good sound design and a nice musicical score, also the voiceover is brilliantly executed.

As always with this kind of game the action and the "story" do not really match. Although it is mostly well driven, I found the storyline a little bit too short and was not given the space tand depth it deserved (at least the middle chapters).
I completed the game in almost 4h.

To me the controls in some puzzles were a tiny bit clunky. Probably something to be patched later on.

Overall, i would say Maquette is one of the best title in this walking narrative sim.

I loved this game, the concept behind it, the music, the voice acting, the effort put into creating such a complex simulation. Admittedly, it was a little rough around the edges - I got stuck a couple of times in the scenery and fell "out of the map" once after walking into some rocks - and the logic of some of the puzzles eluded me for way too long, but I guess that's part of the fun. We need more games with fresh concepts like Maquette, please.

wjuzhang
289 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
Decent but not overly complex puzzle game with a unique rendering system, similar to games like "The Stanley Parable" and "Superliminal". This game is based on a love story that expresses the joys and hardships that can come from the experience; something that many of us can relate with. While playing through this, it made me emotional at times of my own past.

The game can be completed in 4 hours, so if you are looking for a longer story experience, you might have to wait until this game goes on sale or look elsewhere. I feel it was still worth it for the base price. There is a lot of quality work done on this game, and the development team should be very proud of it.
 
Netrics
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
As a whole, this is an absolutely beautiful experience that intertwines a story (an exploration into the memories of a relationship) with the puzzle/game mechanics. It's far from perfect though, from a game perspective, the puzzles are rather simplistic (albeit clever at times) and the game fails to communicate new features. If you want a good puzzler, this is okay at best and frustrating at worst. This game is best approached from the perspective of the story, with the puzzles, game world and mechanics being a reflection of the experiences/memories from a relationship.

At the end of the day, I like to measure games like art, in how they can evoke emotions and lead to reflective/thoughtful experiences; from that perspective, this is a spectacular game.

--

PS. There are a few softlocks I found, so be sure to make safety backups.

Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
Maquette is a beautifully made metaphorical recursive puzzle game. The game is short but worth the experience. The voice acting, puzzle metaphors, carefully procured soundtrack, and well-written dialogue take a somewhat cliche story and make it into an enjoyable gameplay experience.

Yes, the price is a bit high for a 3-hour long game (I really took my time), but if it's not a concern for you, try it out. If you are interested otherwise, put it on your wishlist and try it out on sale.

daniel
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 mars 2021
I'm a sucker for non-euclidean puzzle games, like antichamber or superliminal. If you set a game in a recursive space and slap Anapurna's label on it (they published, among other games, Journey, Goragoa, and Outer Wilds), you've got a guaranteed day-one buyer.

I had high hopes for this game, but I was a bit disappointed in the first half, not gunna lie.

The puzzles in this stage generally fell prey to one of two issues: either they were too simple, and thus "solving" them just felt like gruntwork without any sense of insight or discovery, or else they were too general, with no clear path for progression. Should I try to arrange my items in some way to access the Ferris wheel? Do I need to figure out how to get the bridge out from this tangle of buildings? Is the cube involved in this puzzle in some way? What part, if any, does the Key play? Am I jumping the gun, and trying to solve this puzzle before I'm supposed to? Is there a hidden tiny path I need to find? Do I need to get to this area by approaching it from above?

Not knowing what items were part of the puzzle and which weren't, or whether I was even tackling the puzzle with all the necessary tools, caused me to search too broadly for solutions to puzzles which ultimately turned out to be deceptively simple. (I have no doubt that speedrunners are going to find all sorts of shortcuts the developers may not have intended)

The technical glitches compounded this issue. They're mild, for the most part, and technical issues aren't generally a huge concern for me anyway. But there are some collision and movement glitches, and in a game like this, it makes me lose faith that the developers really considered every possibility.

For example, In "The Wedge" I managed to escape not only the main world walls, but the GIANT world walls as well, and found myself stranded. With nothing else better to do and nowhere else to go, I tried to test my limits and see how far out I could reach. Rather than finding an achievement, easter egg, or progression opportunity, the map just ended. The devs need to either fix that sort of thing or offer players in-game rewards for finding it. Since they didn't, I was more reluctant than I should have been to take actions that were irreversible, because those actions were just out of the box enough that I wasn't confident that they'd been taken into consideration. To the game's credit, areas that are no longer necessary for progression are walled off with an opaque film, but that fix seems a little contrived. That film doesn't really serve any narrative or symbolic purpose.

The story itself is alright, but early on it feels like it meanders a bit more than strictly necessary, and the puzzles amplify that effect.

Fortunately, the game redeems itself in the second half. The items and gameplay complement the story much better, and the puzzles become much more focused (with the exception of a very annoying puzzle near the end involving key size. The solution, when I looked it up, made me feel cheated, mostly because the solution is one of those "outside the box" solutions the game had trained to STOP looking for in the first half).

The last chapter lets you play with the recursive space, and boy, can you make yourself feel small! That's the sort of novel experience I bought this game for. I've never had such a visceral sense of vastness from any other game.

The very last puzzle has a solution that I thought was particularly clever, and the story is taken in a direction I wasn't expecting, but which I definitely prefer to the typical romantic story formula.

I might play this game again in the future just to toy with recursion in the last chapter, but I doubt it will make a lasting impression on me as one of the great narrative/puzzle games. On the whole, it was an enjoyable experience that I'd cautiously recommend-- though certainly not at full price.







 
strategy_zro_x

Absolutely Beautiful Game. The art is incredible. The story is bittersweet but real and the voice-acting performances are great. Puzzle mechanics are simplistic but tricky enough to stump you once or twice. The music is "personal" and fits the San Francisco vibe this game cultures. Overall definitely worth the price tag despite only being 3-4 hours long.

Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
Produit remboursé

Le jeu est prometteur avec un concept original, mais l'ergonomie pour poser et ramasser les objets est assez étrange pour ne pas dire mal faite, ajoutez à cela un bug bloquant (énigme avec les cristaux) avec une auto sav qui ce fait après le bug ce qui oblige à recommencer le jeu depuis le début ! Voilà les raisons qui m'ont fait demander le remboursement en attendant quelques patchs ! J'adore les jeux de Graceful Decay, c'est pour ça que je met quand même un pouce positif !
 
Kinderheim
1,565 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
I enjoyed the game, from two points of view. 3 hrs of game play... I'd buy it again, but for the price I feel it should be a bit longer, or the price should be a bit less (not a lot like $12-$15 not on sale, or 1-1.5 hrs longer for the $17-$20 it's listed as).

You can skip reading the story and just play for the puzzles, in which case they're fun and a nice challenge - from this POV the game is pretty short.

You can read and follow the story, empathize with the narrator and think of your own life experiences, in which case it's a story about healing after a difficult time. It makes the game feel longer and takes a bit more energy.

The M/KB controls could use some refinement - at times object placement movement would hang up and the frustration would distract/pull me out of the immersion.

As another reviewer mentioned i have some confusion on story POV - the narration is either both, or his. but the text and the intentions usage of his nick name in text and in her saying in her VA, makes it seem like she is the narrator. Maybe it's supposed to be both of them, but the audio leads me to think it's him and the open and closing text makes me think it's her.
 
Chinsukolo
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mars 2021
Très bon jeu de puzzle d'environ 4h. Avec une mécanique très originale : La récursivité (le trailer doit être suffisamment parlant).

Cela peut paraître un peu court pour un jeu de puzzle, mais cela serait oublier tout le côté narratif du titre très présent. Effectivement le jeu va nous raconter une histoire entre deux personnes, aux travers de voix et de décors. Une narration "d'ambiance" qui va nous intriguer et qui va donc être une source de motivation pour le joueur. Les deux acteurs sont vraiment excellent et on s'attache très vite aux personnages. J'ai personnellement vraiment apprécier cette dimension narrative du jeu, dans l’originalité de sa narration, dans son ambiance et dans le thème abordé qui parlera certainement à tout le monde.

Je recommande le jeu pour les amateurs de jeu de puzzle et/ou pour les amateurs de jeu narratif.
 
KaluNight
0
